meta.name: Dark Matter
meta.description: A puzzly 8-part deep space adventure and sequel to The Path to Carcosa.
meta.author: Axolotl

cards.flavor: "Granny Orne? Why are you in space?"
cards.name: Anachronism
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, either discard a non-story asset you control, or take 1 horror.

cards.name: Haunting Past
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (X). X is your "Memories." If you fail, search the encounter deck for the topmost hidden card and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.

cards.name: Reminiscence (Pledge)
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. [reaction] When an investigator would defeat an enemy at your location, heal all damage from it instead: Discard this card. Forced - When the game ends, or if you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: Add it to the victory display.

cards.name: Reminiscence (Secrets)
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. [reaction] When an investigator would discover any amount of clues from your location, place 1 of their clues on that location instead of discovering clues: Discard this card. Forced - When the game ends, or if you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: Add it to the victory display.

cards.name: Reminiscence (Covenant)
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. [reaction] When an investigator would successfully evade an enemy at your location, that enemy immediately attacks them instead: Discard this card. Forced - When the game ends, or if you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: Add it to the victory display.

cards.name: The Feaster from Afar
cards.text: Massive. Revelation - Spawn the Feaster from Afar at your location. Forced - After The Feaster from Afar attacks you: Heal all damage from it and place it at the bottom of the scanning deck.

cards.name: Call of the Void
cards.text: Surge. Cannot be cancelled or ignored. Revelation - If there are 3 or more tally marks under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log, shuffle the set aside The Feaster from Afar enemy into the scanning deck. Then, remove Call of the Void from the game.

cards.flavor: Horror vacui -- nature abhors a vacuum.
cards.name: Cold Vacuum
cards.text: Revelation - Test [combat] (3). If you fail, you must either (choose one): Discard a non-story asset you control, or choose and discard 3 cards from your hand.

cards.flavor: They may appear insignificantly small -- but make no mistake.
cards.name: Micrometeoroid
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either (choose one): Take 2 damage, or discard each event in your hand.

cards.name: The Colors of Space
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, put this card into play in your threat area. You must commit all eligible skill cards in your hand to skill tests performed at your location. [action] Take 1 horror: Discard The Colors of Space.

cards.name: Grim Future
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Add Grim Future to any investigator's threat area. Forced - When the act or agenda advances: Take 1 damage and 1 horror. Test[agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Grim Future.

cards.name: Future Evils
cards.text: Revelation - Put Future Evils into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After a scenario card places any amount of doom on a card: Place 1 additional doom and discard Future Evils. This effect may cause the current agenda to advance.

cards.name: The Tatterdemalion
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[AI]] encounter cards in your threat area.
[cultist]: -2. If you fail, place 1 of your clues onto your current location.

cards.name: The Tatterdemalion
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[AI]] encounter cards in play.
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, place 1 of your clues onto your current location.

cards.flavor:
As you try to make sense of the situation, an alarm blares through the chambers and interrupts your thoughts. 
<center><family "Agency FB">ALERT.
ENGINE STABILITY AT 7%.
SYSTEM POWER CRITICAL.
REQUIRES IMMEDIATE ATTENTION.
</family>
cards.name: Emergency Procedure
cards.text: You cannot resign. (Beware -- If this agenda advances, the ship will explode and everyone will die.)

cards.name: Reactor Overload
cards.text: The reactor core melts down and detonates, annihilating the Tatterdemalion. In your last moments, you see a bright yellow crown reigning in the vastness of space. Each investigator is killed. The investigators lose the campaign. There is no resolution.

cards.flavor: The computerized voices sob and sing snippets of nursery rhymes. The ship's lights flicker along and the automated hatches snap open and closed. The Tatterdemalion has a mind of its own.
cards.name: The Ghost Ship
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues on your current location: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with an icon matching your current location and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

cards.name: UPL-A21 'Demhe'
cards.text: Spawn -- Cargo Hold. Hunter. While moving or engaging, UPL-A21 'Demhe' ignores investigators without an [[AI]] encounter card in their threat area. "TARGET ACQUIRED"

cards.flavor: The ship's AI is reaching out to every machine, to manipulate, to control. Hopelessly lost in its own insanity, it will stop at nothing to exterminate the intruders that are invading its home.
cards.name: Rise of the Machines
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues on your current location: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with an icon matching your current location and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

cards.name: Blackout
cards.text:
Without warning, all of the lights in your room shut off. A loud mechanical thud and a sharp pain in the back of your head are the last things you remember before you plummet to the floor, into unconsciousness.
Each remaining undefeated investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.

cards.flavor: Your body aches and cramps from the extended cryosleep. How long have you been trapped in your frozen tomb? Where is the rest of the crew? These questions will need to wait, for you must first find a way to get this ship back online before the reactor engines overheat.
cards.name: Event Horizon
cards.text: Objective - Investigators in the Engine Room may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to repair the power malfunction and advance.

cards.name: Systems Online
cards.text:
As the nuclear-ion engines begin their reboot sequence, the emergency lights shut off and leave you in darkness. You see glimpses of an image -- of a memory. A great golden palace stands before you, older than time itself. A throne befit for a Queen, reigning over the infinite void of a sunless space. When the main fluorescent lights return, an ear piercing scream resonates out of the intercom system. It is the sound of several children's roboticized voices crying out in unison. "Intruders detected! Go away! Please, leave us alone!"
Shuffle the set aside Artificial Intelligence encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. This set is indicated by the following icon: Advance to agenda 2a and act 2a. Do not remove doom from play and transfer all doom from agenda 1a to agenda 2a.

cards.flavor: Restoring power to the Tatterdemalion's systems activated a new problem -- the ship's malfunctioning AI is now operational, and trying to terminate you. You must find a way to fix it or shut it down before it expels you from the ship.
cards.name: Artifical Insanity
cards.text: Objective - Figure out how to repair or disable the insane cybernetic AI. (You will be instructed when to advance.)

cards.name: The Realm of Dreams
cards.text:
It would be impossible to physically bypass or rewire K2-PS187. However, there is another way to repair the 'computer'. If you can reprogram the cryosleep chamber's dream protocols to interface with K2-PS187, you will essentially create a pocket reality in which you can virtually interact with K2-PS187 within its dreams. From there, you'll be able to bring the poor minds back to their senses. However, without proper psychological conditioning, entering the virtual reality may be damaging to your identity -- leaving you in a state of decoherence. Although some of your procedural memories have returned, your self-identity is still out of tune. You may want to explore the ship and remember who you used to be.
Put the set aside Virtual Access Key story asset into play under any investigator's control. That investigator may choose to add it to their deck. This card does not count towards that investigator's deck limit.

cards.flavor: You must find a way to reprogram the cryosleep chambers to access K2-PS187's virtual dreamscape and calm it down.
cards.name: Reconnected
cards.text: Objective - After an investigator at the Cryosleep Quarters performs a scan matching the icon below, regardless of whether it is successful or not, you may advance. (Beware -- remember to recollect as many memories as you can.)

cards.name: Through the Gates of the Virtual Dreamlands
cards.text: By connecting to the ship's mainframe, you adapt the cryo-chambers to import your soon-to-be dreaming self into K2-PS187's shared dreams. You lay down into your coffin once more and activate the machine's sleep sequence...(→R1)

cards.flavor:
"Inside, wrapped in a discoloured parchment, was a huge key of tarnished silver covered with cryptical arabesques; but of any legible explanation there was none."
– H. P. Lovecraft, "The Silver Key"
cards.name: Virtual Access Key
cards.subname: Key to the Gate of Dreams
cards.text: [reaction] When you would take horror, exhaust Virtual Access Key: Cancel 1 of that horror.

cards.flavor: As you step through the door, you see dozens of corpses, mutilated and mangled. Scrawled on the floor, in blood and gore, are the words "no hope".
cards.name: Cargo Hold
cards.text: Forced - After you enter the Cargo Hold: Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, take 1 horror.

cards.name: Cargo Hold
cards.text: The pressure door leading to the back of the ship needs to be rewired. As an additional cost to enter the Cargo Hold, investigators in the Mess Hall must spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.flavor: The room looks like a funeral parlor with six human-sized boxes lined up along the walls. Cold lights shine down from the ceiling, illuminating every corner.
cards.name: Cryosleep Quarters
cards.text: [action]: Resign. Return to your cryo-chamber and hope you wake up from this nightmare.

cards.flavor: Human interstellar space travel was only possible due to the invention of cryo-chambers, capable of suspending the body’s autonomic functions while maintaining the health of each individual cell during stasis.
cards.name: Cryosleep Quarters

cards.flavor: The huge room hums. The vibrations under your feet are so thick, they reach straight through the soles of your shoes. Everything looks and feels too hot.
cards.name: Engine Room
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at the Engine Room and do not control Radiation Tablets: Take 1 damage.

cards.flavor: Although nuclear-ion engines allow for relatively safe intrasolar travel and can power all nominal functions of a Kepler-class starship, this type of generator is prone to overheating.
cards.name: Engine Room

cards.flavor: Slammed together, like compacted teeth, are the three empty coffins. Further inspection reveals that the escape pods have all been sabotaged.
cards.name: Escape Pod Bay
cards.text: [reaction] After you succeed at evading an enemy at this location: Defeat that enemy. (Group limit 3 times per game.)

cards.flavor: Escape pods are an essential asset of any starship. Even though the chances of finding a pod drifting through endless space is infinitely minuscule, it offers travellers peace of mind -- and hope.
cards.name: Escape Pod Bay
Infirmary
cards.text: [action]: Scan. Look for medical supplies. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with the icon below and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

cards.flavor: A common ship infirmary by Colonial standards is well stocked with medical supplies of all kinds.
cards.name: Infirmary

cards.flavor: No signs of human activity. There is enough food to feed the entire waking crew for months -- even years.
cards.name: Mess Hall
cards.text: [reaction] When you gain any amount of resources during your turn at the Mess Hall: Gain 1 additional resource. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: The mess hall is the center of the ship -- both physically and spiritually. Without social bonding, the isolation of space would take its toll on anyone.
cards.name: Mess Hall

cards.flavor: There is a whole bank of instruments and controls. It will take some time to decipher how to read them.
cards.name: Ship's Bridge
cards.text: Forced - After you perform a scan at this location, if there are no clues on it: Add 1[per_investigator] clues on it from the token bank.

cards.name: Ship's Bridge
cards.text: Investigators cannot enter the Ship's Bridge from the Mess Hall. Your access level is restricted. You will need to find another way inside.

cards.flavor: Highly virulent, techno-organic viruses are often used by computers as natural defense mechanisms against virtual invaders.
cards.name: Cybervirus
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced -- After you discover the last clue from a location: Spawn Cybervirus engaged with you.

cards.name: EVA Suit
cards.text: Revelation - You may put EVA Suit into play under the control of any investigator. [action] [action] If you are at an [[Access]] location: Move to another [[Access]] location. Then, Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with the icon below and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

cards.name: Final Destination
cards.text:
You search the Tatterdemalion's console and discover its itinerary. Over a year ago, the ship departed in search of a trans-Saturnian asteroid of extrasolar origin codenamed "Fragment". The crew eventually found the mysterious object and sent several survey and excavation teams for unknown purposes. The mission proceeded smoothly, until the Tatterdemalion suddenly lost contact with one of its survey teams deep within the subterranean caverns of Fragment. Despite the disappearance, the mission was apparently deemed a success, and the ship was set to return home. You vaguely recall stepping out of a shuttle, onto the rocky surface of a golden asteroid. The stars glittered bright and red. You must have been on one of the Tatterdemalion's survey teams.
Each investigator at your location adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories". You may gain up to 3 resources. Add this card to the victory display. Victory 1.

cards.name: Heir to Carcosa
cards.text: Revelation - Add Heir to Carcosa to your deck. Permanent. When earning experience during the resolution of a scenario, the investigator with the least mental trauma (choose one if there are more than one) earns 1 additional experience for each of their mental trauma.

cards.name: Into the Archives
cards.text:
Within the digital environment of the ship, you come across a vault containing petabytes of encrypted data. It appears that the Tatterdemalion's archives contain the brain scans and histories of hundreds of people from the 20th and 21st century. Curious, you search for your own name and are surprised to find files corresponding to your past life. According to these records, you were institutionalized after attempting to sabotage a theatre play. You lived the rest of your life in isolation, warning to all of "Carcosa" and of the one named "Hastur". After your death, your brain was preserved by the institution and eventually scanned for scientific research. Despite feeling sorrow for your past life, you can finally let go of that reality. Even though it's not exactly the world you expected, you've been given a second chance at life, and aim to not repeat the same mistakes.
Each investigator at your location adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories". You may heal up to 2 horror. Add this card to the victory display. Victory 1.

cards.name: JV-7 'Hyades'
cards.text: Aloof. Alert. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, JV-7 'Hyades' attacks you. If you succeed, choose one of the icons below. Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with the chosen icon and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

cards.name: K2-PS187 Cybernetic Brains
cards.text:
You finally uncover the direct access point to interface with the Tatterdemalion's main computer, K2-PS187. However, you quickly realize that disabling or rewiring it will not be as simple as you anticipated. K2-PS187 is not a true computer at all, and is actually a cybernetic organism. Deep within the mechanics of the ship’s bridge is the computer core, and within it are the disembodied brains of six young children. These brains are linked together to form a very powerful super-computer. The situation sickens you to the core. Who would do such a thing? Damning these minds to an eternity of calculating ship trajectories and processing algorithms. You feel guilty, knowing that you must have been part of this heinous crew.
Each investigator adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories", regardless of their location. Advance to act 2b. Add this card to the victory display. Victory 1.

cards.name: LR-02 'Hali'
cards.text: Aloof. Retaliate. Forced - After you defeat this enemy: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with the icon below and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

cards.name: Medical Foam
cards.text: Revelation - You may put this card into play under the control of any investigator. Uses (3 supplies). [reaction] After an investigator at your location takes any amount of damage, exhaust Medical Foam and spend 1 supply: Heal that amount of damage from them.

cards.name: Mind-Machine Interface
cards.text: Revelation - You may put this card into play under the control of any investigator. [action] Spend 2[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with the icon below and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

cards.name: Radiation Tablets
cards.text: Revelation - You may put this card into play under the control of any investigator. Uses (3 supplies). [free] Spend 1 supply: You get +1 [combat] and +1 [agility] until the end of the round.

cards.name: Strange is the Night
cards.text:
Donning the EVA suit, you leave the pressurized atmosphere of the ship to climb across the outside of the vessel. The Tatterdemalion appears much larger from the outside -- you barely see the access point on the other side. It will take quite some time to traverse the ship. As you glide forwards, a glint from above catches your eye. A yellow and green flare undulates in the canvas of space. It dances in the sky and entwines into a singular design -- rings of concentric semicircles lined with strange runes, and at the center is a pair of wavy lines. You have seen this symbol before -- during the presentation of The King in Yellow. However, this wasn't the one in the Ward Theatre, but an amateur performance in the cramped and industrial interior of the Tatterdemalion. After the strange lights fade away, you realize you completely let go of your tethers and were beginning to drift away. With a small thrust of your suit's reaction control system, you grab hold of the ship once more and hastily climb your way to the next airlock, with a much firmer grip.
Add 2 tally marks next to your "Memories". Add this card to the victory display. Victory 1.

cards.flavor: An endless maze of cramped and dirty tunnels.
cards.name: Ventilation Shaft
cards.text: Revelation - Put this location into play. Forced - When you would enter Ventilation Shaft: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.

cards.name: What Type of Ship is This?
cards.text:
Near the stern of the vessel is a large structure of human bones and skulls. At the top of the creation is a wax sculpture of a female figure in a yellow dress. The sculpture itself must be at least a hundred years old. It all seems so surreal, and sad. In front of the strange altar lies a scroll which holds the first draft of a new prayer being written to a "Tassilda, Royal Princess of Carcosa." You are certain you have heard this name before, but you can't recall when.
Each investigator at your location adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories". You must either (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda and add this card to the victory display. This effect may cause the current agenda to advance. - Remove this card from the game. Victory 2.

cards.name: Who am I?
cards.text:
Now that the ship's power has been restored and the imminent threat eliminated, you can re-examine the protocols of the cryo-chamber in which you were hibernating. The database mentions names and dates you have never heard of before, but that you instinctively know refer to you and your true history. According to the control panel, you were a citizen of the United Colonial Coalition, and you were born in 2127, in a city named New Brooklyn. Further details suggest that the ship's AI has been implanting and running a simulation with the bodies of several of the sleeping crew. You probe for more information, but the main network catches on and shuts down the display before you can continue.
Each investigator at your location adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories". You may search the top 6 cards of your deck for a card and draw it. Add this card to the victory display. Victory 1.

cards.name: Artificial Gravity Malfunction
cards.text: Revelation - Attach this card to your current location. While you are at attached location, each move action and [action] ability costs 1 additional action. [reaction] At the end of the round, if you are at attached location: Discard Artificial Gravity Malfunction.

cards.name: Cabin Pressure
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - At the end of your turn, if there are 1 or more clues on your location: Take 2 damage and discard Cabin Pressure. [action][action]: Discard Cabin Pressure.

cards.flavor: Without coolant, heat generating structures in a vacuum would get really hot, really fast.
cards.name: Coolant Leak
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). For each point you fail by, either choose and discard a card from your hand, or take 1 damage. If you control the EVA Suit story asset, you automatically succeed.

cards.flavor: "Splat."
cards.name: Decompression
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Decompression to the nearest [[Access]] location. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at attached location without the EVA Suit story asset takes 3 direct damage. Discard Decompression.

cards.flavor: The biggest source of ionizing radiation is from solar particle events, the repercussions of having a Sun.
cards.name: High Radiation Levels
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] or [combat] (3). If you fail, deal 1 direct damage to your investigator and to each [[Ally]] asset you control. If you control Radiation Tablets, you automatically succeed at this test.

cards.name: All-Seeing Eye
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play in your threat area. As an additional cost to perform a scan, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an [[AI]] encounter card is discarded and draw it. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard All-Seeing Eye.

cards.flavor: Arcs of electricity erupt from the nearest machinery towards you.
cards.name: Electric Surge
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (2). This test gains +1 difficulty for each [[AI]] encounter card in your threat area. If you fail, each investigator at your location takes 1 damage, and Electric Surge gains surge.

cards.name: Hallucinatory Holograms
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - At the end of your turn, if there is at least 1 [[AI]] encounter card in your threat area: Take 2 horror and discard Hallucinatory Holograms. [action][action]: Discard Hallucinatory Holograms.

cards.name: Predictive Algorithm
cards.text: Revelation - Put Predictive Algorithm into play in your threat area. You get -1 to each of your skills while fighting or evading [[AI]] enemies. [action] Choose and discard 2 cards from your hand: Discard Predictive Algorithm.

cards.flavor: The ATL-4 model spider bots can sneak into the crevices of machines to repair malfunctions from within.
cards.name: System Bug
cards.text: Spawn - Nearest location with no clues. Forced - After System Bug enters play: Place 1 clue on its location (from the token bank).

cards.name: Electric Nightmare
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half of your "Memories" (rounded down).
[cultist]: -2. If you fail and you have a hidden card in your hand, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. Double that token's modifier.

cards.name: Electric Nightmare
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is your "Memories."
[cultist]: -3. If you fail and you have a hidden card in your hand, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. Double that token's modifier.

cards.flavor: K2-PS187's virtual dreamscape is strikingly realistic. You feel the tingle of each hair and smell the worms in the ground below you. All sensations are amplified by the direct stimulation of the sensorimotor cortex. In this world, it is difficult to distinguish between the simulated and the hallucinated.
cards.name: Figment of Your Imagination
cards.text: Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it.

cards.name: NIGHT TERROR
cards.text:
You hear a giggling laughter that echoes through the virtual landscape. Footsteps shuffle from somewhere nearby, growing steadily louder. A nightmarish fiend creeps out of the shadows. Standing seven feet tall, with a white-painted face, red-ringed eyes, and unnatural yellow curly hair, the thing almost looks like a clown. But no real clown would ever wear the tattered, moldy, yellow-and black costume it’s garbed in. No clown’s eyes would ever be filled with such crazed menace. It smiles unnaturally wide, showing row upon row of sharp, triangular teeth. Upon its head is an old-fashioned doctor’s round reflector; around its neck hangs a stethoscope. It raises its fingers and you can see that each finger ends in a long, old-fashioned hypodermic needle. This can only be every child’s worst nightmare, and you instantly, almost instinctively, know what this creature must be. This is the Boogeyman.
If it is act 1, spawn the set aside The Boogeyman enemy at the School Grounds, exhausted. If it is act 2, spawn the set aside The Boogeyman enemy at the Entrance Hall, exhausted. Regardless of the current act, shuffle the set aside The Boogeyman encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. This set is indicated by the following icon:

cards.name: IT
cards.text: A-HA! A-HA! A-HA! Don't you wanna play with me? Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase, if The Boogeyman is at the same location as an [[Avatar]] story asset: Place 1 doom on that story asset.

cards.name: FEAR
cards.text: What took you so long? Now we can play forever and ever and ever. Each remaining investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor: You approach the virtual school and pull open the double doors, only to reveal a solid brick wall behind it. The simulation appears to have been tinkered with. You will need to find another way inside.
cards.name: Public School 187 (v. 1.0)
cards.text: Locations cannot be switched with each other. Objective -- After an investigator reveals the Entrance Hall, immediately advance.

cards.name: Scrambled Minds
cards.text:
It doesn't take long for you to realize that something is horribly wrong. The interior is tangled in an impossible maze of hallways, spurting off into every direction.The school's simulation has been completely corrupted. It will be impossible to find the children without first restoring the layout, one segment of code at a time.
Put the set aside Undefined Room locations into play in the area around the Entrance Hall, according to the following schematic of icons: (Where is the Entrance Hall.)

cards.flavor: You approach the virtual school and pull open the double doors, only to reveal a solid brick wall behind it. The simulation appears to have been tinkered with. You will need to find another way inside.
cards.name: Public School 187 (v. 2.0)
cards.text: Locations cannot be switched with each other. Objective -- After an investigator reveals the Entrance Hall, immediately advance.

cards.name: Scrambled Minds
cards.text:
It doesn't take long for you to realize that something is horribly wrong. The interior is tangled in an impossible maze of hallways, spurting off into every direction.The school's simulation has been completely corrupted. It will be impossible to find the children without first restoring the layout, one segment of code at a time.
Put the set aside Undefined Room locations into play in the area around the Entrance Hall, according to the following schematic of icons: (Where is the Entrance Hall.)

cards.flavor: You approach the virtual school and pull open the double doors, only to reveal a solid brick wall behind it. The simulation appears to have been tinkered with. You will need to find another way inside.
cards.name: Public School 187 (v. 3.0)
cards.text: Locations cannot be switched with each other. Objective -- After an investigator reveals the Entrance Hall, immediately advance.

cards.name: Scrambled Minds
cards.text:
It doesn't take long for you to realize that something is horribly wrong. The interior is tangled in an impossible maze of hallways, spurting off into every direction.The school's simulation has been completely corrupted. It will be impossible to find the children without first restoring the layout, one segment of code at a time.
Put the set aside Undefined Room locations into play in the area around the Entrance Hall, according to the following schematic of icons: (Where is the Entrance Hall.)

cards.flavor: The layout of the building has been scrambled into an impossible labyrinth. You will first need to restore the school to its former self before finding the children.
cards.name: Psychoanalysis
cards.text: [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Switch two adjacent locations with each other. Objective -- At the end of the round, if the configuration of [[School]] locations correspond to the following schematic, advance.

cards.name: Just a Bad Dream
cards.text:
When the school's simulation has finally been restored, a choir of children's voices cry out, insane with terror, from the school's intercom system. "What did you do? We scrambled the school so the Boogeyman couldn't find us! It's coming to eat us!" You realize now that the corruption of the school and the Boogeyman itself are not an outside influence -- they are the manifestations of the childrens' insanity, the personifications of their fears. What could have driven them to the edge of sanity? Regardless, if you can convince them that the monster stems from their own simulated imagination, perhaps you can save them before they are completely consumed by the terror.
If The Boogeyman is not in play, spawn the set aside The Boogeyman enemy in the Entrance Hall. Reveal all unrevealed locations. Randomly attach a set aside [[Avatar]] story asset to Classroom K2, Library, Gymnasium and Biology Lab. (one to each location) If The Boogeyman is at a location with an [[Avatar]] story asset, attach that [[Avatar]] story asset to the Cafeteria.

cards.flavor: You must help the children overcome their nightmare before they are consumed by it. Now that you are familiar with the architecture of the school, perhaps you can modify it to your advantage.
cards.name: Facing Your Fears
cards.text: [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Switch two adjacent locations with each other. Objective - Save as many of the children as you can! If The Boogeyman is defeated, advance.

cards.name: Nothing to Fear
cards.text:
Without fear and terror of its victims minds to prey on, the horrific digital monstrosity deflates like a balloon and dissipates into the simulation.
(→R3)

cards.name: Maja
cards.text: [free] Choose and discard 3 cards from your hand: Disengage from each enemy engaged with you and move to any connecting location. Investigators at any location may trigger this ability.

cards.name: Reintegrated
cards.text:
You calm down the boy hiding under the desk and manage to convince him that the Boogeyman is no match for your combined strength and confidence. He stands up and yells towards the fiendish monstrosity. "We're not scared of you. You're just a clown!" The abomination cries out in pain as its hypodermic claws shrink and morph into limp red gloves. The boy introduces himself as David. "I'm in charge of the engines and the main power. I've been feeling awfully sick lately, but thank goodness my stomach finally stopped hurting." You tell David to wait for you outside the school, and he quickly runs off.
Place 1 horror token on The Boogeyman from the token pool. If there are 4 horror tokens on The Boogeyman, it is defeated. Add this card to the victory display. Victory 1.

cards.name: David
cards.text: [action] If The Boogeyman is at the location above or below David's location: Parley. Test [combat] (2). If you succeed, flip him over and resolve the text on the other side.

cards.name: Reintegrated
cards.text:
You catch up with the boy that is frantically running around and calm him down by convincing him that the Boogeyman will never actually reach him, as it only means to scare him. When the nightmare stops dead in its tracks in front of you, the boy finally sighs in relief. Without the sustenance of the child's fear, the creature's wicked arms and legs shrink to a more comprehensible size. "You can call me Will. I'm in charge of the ship's navigation systems and docking procedures." You tell him to wait for you outside, and he complies without hesitation.
Place 1 horror token on The Boogeyman from the token pool. If there are 4 horror tokens on The Boogeyman, it is defeated. Add this card to the victory display. Victory 1.

cards.name: William
cards.text: [action] If The Boogeyman is at the location above or below William's location: Parley. Test [agility] (2). If you succeed, flip him over and resolve the text on the other side.

cards.name: Reintegrated
cards.text:
With patience and care, you reassure Alma and persuade her to open her eyes and carefully scrutinize the simulated nightmare. Through her fingers, she finally notices the subtle discrepancies that can only be observed from specific angles, thus breaking the illusion of the dreadful monster. Without the sustenance of Alma's fear, the Boogeyman's thousand yellow teeth fall out of its gaping maw and shatter across the ceramic floor. "Thanks for helping us! I'm Alma, and I'm charge of environmental controls on the ship. It's really cold... I need a jacket." The little girl strolls out of the school without fear.
Place 1 horror token on The Boogeyman from the token pool. If there are 4 horror tokens on The Boogeyman, it is defeated. Add this card to the victory display. Victory 1.

cards.name: Alma
cards.text: [action] If The Boogeyman is at the location above or below Alma's location: Parley. Test [willpower] (2). If you succeed, flip her over and resolve the text on the other side.

cards.name: Reintegrated
cards.text:
You persuade the anxious girl that the monster's simple artificial intelligence can easily be outwitted and avoided. She observes the Boogeyman's movements, and finally nods in agreement. You both watch as the tattered clown's head deflates like a balloon, and its voice garbles into gibberish. The girl thanks you for your help. "My name is Tilde. I'm in charge of the ship's digital mainframe and cyber-security. I've had a headache for a while, but now I am feeling much better." She carefully navigates around the Boogeyman and exits the school building.
Place 1 horror token on The Boogeyman from the token pool. If there are 4 horror tokens on The Boogeyman, it is defeated. Add this card to the victory display. Victory 1.

cards.name: Tilde
cards.text: [action] If The Boogeyman is at the location above or below Tilde's location: Parley. Test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, flip her over and resolve the text on the other side.

cards.name: Desync
cards.text: Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Suffer 1 mental trauma and add 1 tally mark next to your "Memories". Then, exile this card. - If your deck has 5 or more cards in it, shufflethis card back into your deck. Otherwise,discard it.

cards.name: K2-PS187
cards.text: Permanent. [reaction] At the start of the round, choose an investigator: That investigator gets an additional action during their turn, which may only be used to activate Scan abilities.

cards.name: K2-PS187
cards.text: Permanent. [free] During the investigation phase, choose an investigator: That investigator gets an additional action during their turn, which may only be used to activate Scan abilities. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: K2-PS187
cards.text: Permanent. [free] During the investigation phase, choose an investigator: That investigator gets an additional action during their turn, which may only be used to activate Scan abilities. (Limit once per round.) [reaction] After an investigator performs an unsuccessful scan: That investigator may draw 1 card or gain 1 resource.

cards.name: K2-PS187
cards.text: Permanent. [free] During the investigation phase, choose an investigator: That investigator gets an additional action during their turn, which may only be used to activate Scan abilities. (Limit once per round.) [reaction] After an investigator performs a scan: That investigator may draw 1 card or gain 1 resource. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: The scent of soylent emanates through the air, with no obvious source.
cards.name: Cafeteria
cards.text: [action]: Investigate. This test gets +2 difficulty. If you succeed, discover an additional clue from an adjacent location.

cards.flavor: The empty hallways echo every sound you make, announcing your arrival to whatever horrors lie awaiting. You are lost within this giant jigsaw puzzle.
cards.name: Undefined Room

cards.flavor: The textures and materials composing this classroom are particularly detailed.
cards.name: Classroom K2
cards.text: [action]: If Classroom K2 is adjacent to 4 other locations: Each investigator at Classroom K2 adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories". (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: The empty hallways echo every sound you make, announcing your arrival to whatever horrors lie awaiting. You are lost within this giant jigsaw puzzle.
cards.name: Undefined Room

cards.flavor: Desks and chairs float around the entrance. The simulation has been corrupted.
cards.name: Entrance Hall
cards.text: [reaction] After Entrance Hall is switched with another location, if you are at Entrance Hall: Draw 1 card and gain 1 resource. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: There is an digital fissure between the simulated walls of the school. Perhaps Maja can regenerate your virtual avatar through the breach.
cards.name: A Shimmer in the Wall
cards.text: You cannot enter A Shimmer in the Wall except through the [free] ability on Maja.

cards.flavor: The large open field gives you a lot of space to run, but no place to hide.
cards.name: Gymnasium
cards.text: [reaction] When an enemy would enter this location: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, until the end of the round, that enemy cannot engage or attack you.

cards.flavor: The empty hallways echo every sound you make, announcing your arrival to whatever horrors lie awaiting. You are lost within this giant jigsaw puzzle.
cards.name: Undefined Room

cards.flavor: The bark on the branches is splitting and falling off, revealing a black pulpy mass underneath. They all smell of rotting flesh and dank earth.
cards.name: Biology Lab
cards.text: [action]: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror from each investigator at your location. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: The empty hallways echo every sound you make, announcing your arrival to whatever horrors lie awaiting. You are lost within this giant jigsaw puzzle.
cards.name: Undefined Room
Library
cards.text:
X is the the number of adjacent locations
[action] If there are no clues on Library: Switch Library with any other [[School]] location and place 1[per_investigator] clues on it, from the token bank.

cards.flavor: The empty hallways echo every sound you make, announcing your arrival to whatever horrors lie awaiting. You are lost within this giant jigsaw puzzle.
cards.name: Undefined Room

cards.flavor: School's out.
cards.name: School Grounds
cards.text:
While investigating this location, it gains +1 shroud for each of your clues.
[free] If there are no clues on School Grounds: Put the set-aside A Shimmer in the Wall location into play directly above School Grounds.

cards.flavor: The decrepit and abandoned school grounds are eerily quiet. Scattered around the building are dropped books, lunch boxes and tattered backpacks.
cards.name: School Grounds

cards.flavor: You watch as they erode and turn to dust before your eyes.
cards.name: Digital Corrosion
cards.text: Revelation -- Test [willpower] (X). X is the shroud value of your location. For each point you fail by, discard a card from your play area and/or from your hand.

cards.name: Shadow of Thoughts
cards.text: Spawn - Any empty location. Retaliate. X is the shroud value of this enemy's location. Forced -- After this enemy's location is switched with another location: Move this enemy 1 location towards the nearest investigator.

cards.flavor: Who am I?
cards.name: Decoherence
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (6). Decrease the difficulty of this test by 1 for each of your "Memories". If you fail, you must either take 2 horror or lose 2 resources.

cards.name: Duplication
cards.text: Revelation -- Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until 2 [[Virtual]] encounter cards are discarded. Choose and draw one of the discarded [[Virtual]] encounter cards. If it is a treachery, resolve its revelation effect an additional time. If it is an enemy, place this card under it as a swarm card.

cards.flavor: <family "Agency FB">FATAL ERROR
cards.name: Glitch in the System
cards.text: Spawn -- Any empty location. Forced -- After Glitch in the System's location is switched with another location: Place 1 doom on Glitch in the System.

cards.flavor: What is real?
cards.name: Manifested Whispers
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation -- Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are no other investigators at your location and Manifested Whispers is in your hand: Spawn it at your location.

cards.name: Non-Euclidean Geometry
cards.text: Revelation -- Put this card into play in your threat area. Forced -- After your location is switched with another location: Take 1 damage. [action]: Test [agility] (3) or [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Non-Euclidean Geometry.

cards.name: Virtual Byakhee
cards.text: Spawn -- Furthest location from you. Hunter. Forced -- When Virtual Byakhee would move between two locations without investigators: Switch those locations with each other instead.

cards.flavor: A combination of many of the children's greatest fears. The Boogeyman fills the virtual dreamlands with sinister laughter.
cards.name: THE BOOGEYMAN
cards.text:
Massive. Hunter.
Cannot be attacked, damaged or evaded.

cards.flavor: WANT A BALLOON?
cards.name: COME CLOSER
cards.text: Revelation -- Put Come Closer into play in your threat area. Forced -- At the end of your turn, if you are not at The Boogeyman's location: Discard Come Closer and test [willpower] (3). If you fail, move one location towards The Boogeyman.

cards.name: REMEMBER ME?
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation -- Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if The Boogeyman is at your location or an adjacent location, search your discard pile for a weakness and draw it. Then, discard this card.

cards.flavor: DON'T LOOK BEHIND
cards.name: SURPRISE!
cards.text: Peril. Revelation -- Test [willpower] or [agility] (4). If you fail, either move The Boogeyman to your current location, or The Boogeyman immediately attacks you. (from any location)

cards.flavor: DON'T LOOK BEHIND
cards.name: SURPRISE!
cards.text: Peril. Revelation -- Test [willpower] or [agility] (4). If you fail, either move The Boogeyman to your current location, or The Boogeyman immediately attacks you. (from any location)

cards.name: Lost Quantum
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of face-down encounter cards in your threat area. 
[cultist]: -X. X is half the number of locations in play (rounded down).
[tablet]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, put the top card of the encounter deck into your threat area, face-down.
[elder_thing]: -3. Randomly draw a face-down encounter card in your threat area.

cards.name: Lost Quantum
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of face-down encounter cards in your threat area.
[cultist]: -X. X is the number of locations in play.
[tablet]: -2. Reveal another token. If you fail, put the top card of the encounter deck into your threat area, face-down.
[elder_thing]: -4. Randomly draw a face-down encounter card in your threat area.

cards.flavor:
<center>"I think I can safely say that nobody understands quantum mechanics."
<right>-- Richard Feynman
cards.name: The Quantum Maelstrom
cards.text: [action]: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with an icon matching your current location and draw it. If it is a location, put it into play and move to it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

cards.name: Uncertainty Principle
cards.text:
The basic property of quantum materials can be summed up as an elaboration of wave-particle duality. You never truly know what you are dealing with until you know.
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. In player order, each investigator places the top card of the encounter deck into their threat area, face-down. If there is another agenda below this one, set this agenda aside, out of play. Otherwise, add 1 tally mark under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log and shuffle this agenda with each set aside agenda to form a new agenda deck.

cards.flavor:
<center>"I think I can safely say that nobody understands quantum mechanics."
<right>-- Richard Feynman
cards.name: The Quantum Maelstrom
cards.text: [action]: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with an icon matching your current location and draw it. If it is a location, put it into play and move to it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

cards.name: Quantum Tunneling
cards.text:
You only realize now that every time you blink, something changes. Sometimes, a few rocks will shift a few feet. Some other times, you find yourself in a completely new environment.
If the scanning deck is not empty, look at the top card of the scanning deck. If it is a location, put it into play and move each investigator and non-[[Liminal]] enemy to it. Shuffle all empty locations without a resource token on it into the scanning deck. If there is another agenda below this one, set this agenda aside, out of play. Otherwise, add 1 tally mark under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log and shuffle this agenda with each set aside agenda to form a new agenda deck.

cards.flavor:
<center>"I think I can safely say that nobody understands quantum mechanics."
<right>-- Richard Feynman
cards.name: The Quantum Maelstrom
cards.text: [action]: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with an icon matching your current location and draw it. If it is a location, put it into play and move to it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

cards.name: Observer Effect
cards.text:
It doesn't take long for you to realize that there is no such thing as orientation in a place where anything can be simultaneously anywhere. Only the landmarks that you consciously observe will remain in their positions.
Each investigator at a location without a resource token on it places the top card of the encounter deck into their threat area, face-down. Shuffle all empty locations (without enemies or investigators) without a resource token on it into the scanning deck. If there is another agenda below this one, set this agenda aside, out of play. Otherwise, add 1 tally mark under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log and shuffle this agenda with each set aside agenda to form a new agenda deck.

cards.flavor:
<center><family "Agency FB">QUANTUM FIELD UNSTABLE. 
EVACUATE ELBRUS STATION IMMEDIATELY.
</family>
<left>The warning startles you awake. Despite the troubling descent, the lander has coasted into one of the craters with minimal damage. It appears most of the asteroid has already been evacuated -- but then who stayed behind to send you the warning during your descent?
cards.name: Elbrus Station
Quantum Shenanigans
cards.text:
You finally find the lone scientist on the asteroid -- he introduces himself as Erwin Simmons, the lead quantum researcher at the facility. "They stole the stabilizing shards!" Those cultists!" He explains the recent happenings. "Without the shards, the whole asteroid quickly lost itself in uncertainty. Everyone else was evacuated, but I stayed behind to contain the anomaly."
If there are 3 or more tally marks under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log:
"Unfortunately, it's too late -- the maelstrom is affecting my reality. You need to leave this asteroid as soon as you can, lest you get trapped here too!" Before you can react, the physicist fades out of existence right in front of you.
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Shuffle Erwin Simmons (Fading) with the top 3[per_investigator] cards of the encounter deck. Then, distribute them into each investigator's threat area, face-down, as evenly as possible. Proceed to act 2a, Destabilization, and remove act 2a, Quantum Zeno from the game.
Otherwise:
Despite the situation, he believes the facility can still be saved if you are able to help him distribute the modified Q-Crystal shards across the asteroid.
Put the set aside Erwin Simmons (Quantum Physicist) story asset into play under any investigator's control. This story asset does not take up an ally slot for this scenario. Proceed to act 2a, Quantum Zeno, and remove act 2a, Destabilization from the game.

cards.flavor: To restore the equilibrium of matter and save the facility, you must help Erwin install the Q-shards across the asteroid. Only then will the instability collapse.
cards.name: Quantum Zeno
cards.text: [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place a resource token on your location from the token pool. Objective - If there are 8 [[Elbrus]] locations in play, and each location has a resource token on it, you may advance.

cards.name: Certainty
cards.text:
The purple glow of Elbrus subsides as you plant the final Q-Shard into the ground. The mad physicist is overjoyed and relieved. You have completely stabilized the quantum field.
(→R2)

cards.flavor: You need to get out of here as soon as you can, before you are also lost in the quantum realm. Although Erwin is fading out of existence, maybe you can find a way to save him from his ghastly fate..?
cards.name: Destabilization
cards.text: [action]: Draw a face-down encounter card in your threat area. If it is a treachery, you may spend 1 clue to cancel its revelation effect. Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: Uncertainty
cards.text:
If an investigator resigned with Erwin Simmons under their control:
The shuttle takes off in a medley of noises and barely escapes the collapsing quantum field. Erwin looks down at the facility in melancholy. Years of his research, lost in this unreality. Despite the tragedy, he is grateful for your efficacy.
(→R3)
Otherwise:
The shuttle takes off without a hitch and escapes quantum field. The short range radio crackles once more into life and you hear Erwin Simmon's final words. "So long my friends! Hope you enjoyed your stay! Let it be known that --". And it cuts to static.
(→R1)

cards.name: Erwin Simmons
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play under your control. Forced - At the end of the round or when you would resign, if there are face-down encounter cards in any investigator's threat area: Shuffle Erwin Simmons with all face-down encounter cards and distribute them back into each investigator's threat area, as evenly as possible.

cards.name: Erwin Simmons
cards.text: [reaction] When your turn begins, put the top card of the encounter deck face-down into your threat area: Fight/Evade/Investigate. If you fail, deal 1 damage to Erwin Simmons. Forced - When Erwin Simmons leaves play: Draw all face-down encounter cards in your threat area.

cards.flavor: There are no stars in the backdrop of this lost quantum.
cards.name: Cold Wastes
cards.text: As an additional cost to scan at Cold Wastes, you must either (choose one): Spend 2 resources, or choose and discard 2 cards from your hand.

cards.name: Crystal Peak
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if this location is empty and does not have a resource token on it: Shuffle it back into the scanning deck. [free] If there are no clues on this location: Record in your Campaign Log that you have witnessed the primordial chaos. (Max once per game.)

cards.flavor: The misty spires of Elbrus are a formidable sight.
cards.name: Ice Spires
cards.text: Forced - After you scan at this location: Shuffle an empty location without a resource token on it back into the scanning deck.

cards.flavor: The landing gear has been damaged, but nothing you can't fix with a bit of time and material.
cards.name: Landing Craft
cards.text: [free]: Place 1 of your clues onto this location. While there are 2[per_investigator] or more clues on this location, it gains "[action] Resign. Escape this migraine-inducing asteroid."

cards.flavor: Evacuated.
cards.name: Main Facility
cards.text:
X is the number of connecting locations.
[action] [action] Choose a revealed location with no clues on it: Place a resource token on that location. (Max once per game.)

cards.flavor: Spires looming above the horizon -- you are certain you have been here before.
cards.name: Omni-Transmitters
cards.text: [action] Add 1 doom to the current agenda and test [intellect] (2): If you succeed, each investigator at this location adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories". (Max one success per game.)

cards.flavor: When the material was first discovered in 2093, top physicists couldn't understand it. They still don't.
cards.name: Q-Crystal Mines
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Q-Crystal Mines, place the top card of the encounter deck into your threat area, face-down.

cards.name: Schröd Generators
cards.text:
Investigators at this location cannot cancel or ignore card effects or game effects.
[free] If you have 4 or more face-down encounter cards in your threat area, draw 1 of them: Gain 2 clues from the token bank. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Entangled
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Entangled to an investigator or enemy without a copy of Entangled attached. Forced - After attached investigator or enemy takes any amount of damage from a source other than Entangled: Each other investigator or enemy with a copy of Entangled attached also takes that amount of damage. Then, discard Entangled.

cards.name: Hound of Tindalos
cards.text: Massive. Alert. Retaliate. Spawn - Put Hound of Tindalos into play next to the act deck, at no specific location. While you have an odd number of cards in your hand, Hound of Tindalos is considered to be engaged with you.

cards.flavor: What?
cards.name: Incomprehensible
cards.text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (2). For each point you succeed by, take 1 horror (to a maximum of 3 horror.) Skill icons committed to this test subtract from your skill value instead of adding to it.

cards.flavor: An alien drone correcting past mistakes.
cards.name: Mi-Go Stabilizer
cards.text: Spawn - Location with the most clues. Hunter. Forced - After Mi-Go Stabilizer attacks you: Draw a face-down encounter card from your threat area.

cards.name: Paradoxical Threat
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Place the top 3 cards of the encounter deck into your threat area, face-down. - Add 1 doom to the current agenda and draw 3 face-down cards from your threat area.

cards.name: Quantum Collapse
cards.text: Revelation - Draw each face-down encounter card in your threat area, one at a time. If no encounter cards were drawn by this effect, add Quantum Collapse to your threat area, face-down. Forced - After you draw Quantum Collapse from your threat area: Take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: Neither dead nor alive -- rather both at once.
cards.name: Quantum Phantom
cards.text: Forced - When Quantum Phantom is defeated by damage (except from a [[Spell]] or [[Relic]]): Instead of discarding it, place it in your threat area, face-down.

cards.name: Radioactive Decay
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play, in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn: Draw a face-down card in your threat area. If you cannot, take 1 damage and 1 horror instead. [action][action]: Discard Radioactive Decay.

cards.name: In the Shadow of Earth
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the amount of damage on you and assets you control (rounded down).
[cultist]: -2. If you fail, deal 1 damage or 1 horror to an [[Ally]] asset you control.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: 0. You must either (choose one): Take 2 damage, or this test automatically fails.

cards.name: In the Shadow of Earth
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is half the amount of damage on you and assets you control (rounded up).
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, deal 1 damage or 1 horror to an [[Ally]] asset you control.
[tablet]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: 0. You must either (choose one): Take 3 damage, or this test automatically fails.

cards.flavor: You carefully enter the ship through the airlocks of the Nostalgia II. It is eerily silent, other than the occasional clanging and hiss of the air circulation.
cards.name: The Nostalgia II
cards.text: [action] Scan. If the top card of the scanning deck has an icon matching your current location, spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Draw the top card of the scanning deck. Forced - When a [[Crew]] story asset is defeated or discarded: Remove it from the game.

cards.name: In the Open
cards.text:
You were not prepared to hear the horrible ear-piercing roar of disembodied cries. Your motion scanner bleeps uncontrollably -- there is biological movement detected in every direction. Whatever thing that has corrupted this ship has finally noticed your arrival.
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Spawn that enemy at the Ship Mainframe.

cards.flavor: There is an abomination that is creeping around the ship, consuming all biological and mechanical matter within its reach and creating corrupted imitations.
cards.name: The Thing from Earth
cards.text: [action] Scan. If the top card of the scanning deck has an icon matching your current location, spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Draw the top card of the scanning deck. Forced - When a [[Crew]] story asset is defeated or discarded: Remove it from the game.

cards.name: The Lost
cards.text:
You have come to understand that whatever plague has struck upon Earth has been transmitted to the ship as well. Perhaps the ship was too close to Earth's atmosphere -- or perhaps a crew member had accidentally watched one too many of the undecipherable and corrupting transmissions from Earth. Whatever the invisible corruption is, it has begun to affect you as well -- for every time you blink, you see visions of the hell left behind on Earth. Masses of flesh appear around you - sculpting into the shapes of people you once knew.
In player order, each investigator must test [willpower] (3). In your Campaign Log, for each investigator who fails, record that (their investigator name) has been corrupted by the Earth.

cards.flavor: If you stay too long on this ship, there is no doubt that sooner or later, the abomination will come for you too.
cards.name: Scream of the Dead
cards.text: [action] Scan. If the top card of the scanning deck has an icon matching your current location, spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Draw the top card of the scanning deck. Forced - When a [[Crew]] story asset is defeated or discarded: Remove it from the game.

cards.name: Hunger
cards.text:
If there are still cards remaining in the scanning deck:
Another unintelligible scream sounds throughout the Nostalgia II, trembling your ears with force -- the abomination of Earth is closing upon its next prey.
Shuffle the scanning deck and remove the top card of the scanning deck from the game. If it is The Feaster from Afar, spawn it at the lead investigator's location instead. Flip this agenda back to agenda 3a.
If the scanning deck is empty but not the "Evidence" deck: Put the top card of the "Evidence" deck under the scenario reference card. Flip this agenda back to agenda 3a.
If both the scanning deck and the "Evidence" deck are empty: The Entity reveals itself! Get ready for a fight! Advance to act 2b and agenda 4a.

cards.flavor: There is no one to greet you. No responses to your calls. But despite the silence, your motion scanner occasionally displays a few blips of movement coming from within the ship.
cards.name: Is Anyone Home?
cards.text: Objective - When you draw a story asset from the scanning deck, advance.

cards.name: In Hiding
cards.text:
One of the crew members stumbles out in fear. "Thank god someone is here to help! I heard your calls but was too scared to answer. There's something else with us on the ship -- It's already taken some of the crew but not all of us. I don't know who to trust!" They describe an abomination that has been corrupting and consuming all biological and electronic mass on the ship. The entity is able to take on the form of the bodies and equipment it consumes, becoming a perfect imitation of the original. When it all went downhill, the Nostalgia II enacted a rudimentary quarantine procedure, and the crew have been hiding throughout the ship, waiting for help ever since. You can lead the helpless crew member back to the safety of the Tatterdemalion -- but if it is true that this abomination is able to create perfect imitations, how would you know if they are truly human?
Reveal the Ship Mainframe location. Advance to act 2a.

cards.flavor: There are still people hiding on board, among other things. Try to find as many of the Nostalgia II's crew as you can and escape -- but beware, some of crew may not be who they say they are.
cards.name: Save Our Souls
cards.text: Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned: (→R1). (Hint: Bringing an imitation aboard the Tatterdemalion will have severe consequences.)

cards.name: Quarantine
cards.text:
If you advanced this act due to agenda 3b (it is the only way to get here):
You have isolated and confirmed the safety of as many crew members as you can. However, there are still a few that cannot be accounted for. Before you figure out what to with the unconfirmed crew, the abomination reveals itself in a colony of molted flesh and metal, ready to use the corrupted mass it gathered to smother your existence.
Look at the story cards that are under the scenario reference card but do not read them. For each of the story cards, reveal 1 random chaos token from the chaos bag. If it is not a [elder_sign], [bless], '+1', or '0' token, the [[Crew]] story asset corresponding to that story card is an imitation of the Entity! If any of the imitations are in the victory display, proceed to (→R2). Otherwise, perform the following: - Spawn the set aside The Entity enemy at the Ship Mainframe. - Search for all [[Crew]] story assets removed from the game and attach them facedown to the Entity. - Search for all [[Crew]] story assets that are imitations of the Entity and attach them facedown to the Entity.

cards.flavor: The Entity's true form screeches and hurls its tentacles of pulpy mass towards you in anger. You must either escape while you still can, or gather your strengths to exterminate the abomination once and for all!
cards.name: The Shadow of Earth
cards.text: Objective - If The Entity is defeated, advance. Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned: (→R3)

cards.name: Final Farewell
cards.text:
You hear the scream of a thousand dead -- when you arrive at its source, the amalgamation of body parts, biological processes and metallic wiring is dissolving into the floor's grating. The madness has finally been vanquished.
Record in your Campaign Log that you witnessed the manifested madness. Add all [[Crew]] story assets you control and in the scanning deck to the victory display. Proceed to (→R4).

cards.flavor: The fierce and gluttonous entity prepares to assimilate you.
cards.name: It's Weird and Pissed Off.
cards.text: [action] Scan. If the top card of the scanning deck has an icon matching your current location, spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Draw the top card of the scanning deck. Forced - When a [[Crew]] story asset is defeated or discarded: Attach it facedown to the Entity instead. (Hint: The scenario will not end when this agenda advances.)

cards.name: Hunger
cards.text:
The amalgamation catches you off guard -- disassembling into a thousand separate entities and reforming itself right behind you.
The Entity immediately moves to the nearest investigator's location and attacks each investigator at that location. Flip this agenda back to agenda 4a.

cards.name: Space Artillery
cards.text:
Uses (2 supplies).
[action][action] Choose a location and spend 1 supply: Deal 3 damage to each enemy and investigator at that location and at each connecting location.

cards.name: The Entity
cards.text:
Massive. Hunter. Alert.
The Entity gets +2[per_investigator] health for each facedown card attached to it.
Damage and horror dealt by The Entity must be assigned to [[Ally]] assets first.

cards.flavor: The hall is overcome by the smell of rotten flesh permeating through the ozone tinged air.
cards.name: Airlocks
cards.text: [free] "Get to the Tatterdemalion!": Add a [[Crew]] story asset you control to the victory display. [action]: Resign. You should never have come. Remove all [[Crew]] story assets you control from the game.

cards.flavor: There are no responses when you call out for assistance, only echoes mocking you back.
cards.name: Airlocks

cards.flavor: A modest lounge with a dartboard, soft drink dispenser, and large holographic entertainment system. No human to be seen.
cards.name: Crew Quarters
cards.text: [reaction] After you discover the last clue from this location: Each investigator at this location gains 2 resources. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: A ship of this size must contain dozens of crew members to sustain itself. Where is everyone?
cards.name: Crew Quarters

cards.flavor: Bulky and inefficient -- the design of these nuclear engines are almost a century old.
cards.name: Engine Room
cards.text: [action] Deal 2 damage to each investigator and enemy at this location: Gain 2 clues from the token bank. (Limit once per round)

cards.flavor: The rumbles and vibrations increase in magnitude the closer you are to the engines.
cards.name: Engine Room

cards.flavor:
"Day 192 -- Unidentified biological entity still on board. No sign of Noah nor Liz, presumed dead. Crew morale low."
-- Captain Burr, Ship's Log
cards.name: Flight Deck
cards.text: [action] Deal 2 horror to each investigator at this location: Gain 2 clues from the token bank. (Limit once per round)

cards.flavor: For navigators, and those who want to see the splendor of Earth with their own eyes.
cards.name: Flight Deck

cards.flavor: It's been too long since you've last smelled the fresh scent of greenery.
cards.name: Hydroponics
cards.text: [free] If there are no clues on Hydroponics and you have fewer than 3 sanity remaining: Each investigator at this location adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories". (Group limit once per game)

cards.flavor: A self-sustaining ecosystem to provide enough foodstuff for eternity.
cards.name: Hydroponics

cards.flavor: A bloody mess lies in the chair of the surgical chamber -- with no body in sight.
cards.name: Infirmary
cards.text:
[action] Choose an [[Ally]] asset at this location: 
Test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, discard a copy of Contamination attached to them.

cards.flavor: There's almost no type of acute injury that medicine in this century cannot remedy. Unfortunately, healing long term trauma is still a holy grail yet to be discovered.
cards.name: Infirmary

cards.flavor: K2-PS187 calculates that the crew that cannot be accounted for with evidence have a ~15% chance to be safe -- it is up to you if you want to risk the entire mission for them.
cards.name: Ship Mainframe
cards.text: [action] Parley. Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Draw the top card of the "Evidence" deck and read it.

cards.flavor: The Nostalgia II was constructed in the Martian colonies -- where advanced AI has never been created. Some may say that it is a blessing.
cards.name: Ship Mainframe
cards.text: You cannot enter the Ship Mainframe. Your access level is restricted.

cards.flavor: Static fills the radios -- transmissions from Earth are usually incomprehensible.
cards.name: Telecoms
cards.text: [action] If it is currently act 2, cross out 1[per_investigator] of your "Memories", as a group: Draw the top card of the "Evidence" deck and read it. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: Where the Nostalgia II listens to the last cries of Earth.
cards.name: Telecoms
Adam Tanner
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play under your control. [reaction] When an enemy spawns at your location: You automatically evade it. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.name: Captain Burr
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play under your control. Captain Burr may be assigned direct damage and direct horror dealt to any investigator and [[Ally]] asset at your location.

cards.name: Doctor Feng
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play under your control. [action] [action]: Heal 1 damage from each investigator and [[Ally]] assets at your location. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.name: Lt. "Archer" Michaels
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play under your control. [action]: Deal 2 damage to any enemy in play. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.name: MU-D12 "Mudbug"
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play under your control. [action]: Move 2 damage between investigators, [[Ally]] assets, and enemies at your location. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.name: Sophie
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play under your control. [action] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues: Scan. Draw the top card of the scanning deck as if you were at any location. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.name: Evidence (Adam Tanner)
cards.text:
You decipher a human heat signature that the Nostalgia II's computer mainframe was able to keep track during the events of the phenomenon. The heat signature corresponds to the astrobiologist on the ship, Adam Tanner. It appears that he was busy tending to the plants by himself when the quarantine was put into effect, and has not been in any physical contact with anyone else, proving his humanity.
Adam Tanner is not an imitation. Put this card into play next to the act deck.
Forced - After you draw the Adam Tanner story asset from the scanning deck: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.name: Evidence (Captain Burr)
cards.text:
Exploration of the ship's logs determined that it was the captain of the Nostalgia II, Arnold Burr, who initiated the quarantine when the threat first emerged. Knowing that the Captain must have been at an access point when the orders were set, and that the hatches leading to the possible access points have not been opened since then, you deduce that the Captain must still be human.
Captain Burr is not an imitation. Put this card into play next to the act deck.
Forced - After you draw the Captain Burr story asset from the scanning deck: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.name: Evidence (Doctor Feng)
cards.text:
When you are finally able to access the video recordings for the infirmary, you discover the gnarly events that led up to the quarantine. Doctor Feng had been treating an unknown eye infection in one of the technicians. He was the first to notice that the corruption also took root in some of the medical tools used to examine the poor technician. This proved that whatever was corrupting the ship could also affect electronic equipment as well. Thankfully, the video was able to confirm that the doctor was wearing protective gear and has been hiding in a nearby compartment ever since.
Doctor Feng is not an imitation. Put this card into play next to the act deck.
Forced - After you draw the Doctor Feng story asset from the scanning deck: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.name: Evidence (Lt. "Archer" Michaels)
cards.text:
All firearms aboard the Nostalgia II are continuously monitored by the ship's mainframe. These high-tech weapons also provide biometric information on their wielders while they are in their hands. Without too much hassle, you were able to determine that the lieutenant of the ship has not been consumed and imitated by the Entity -- notably because they have been holding onto their handgun the entire time.
Lt. "Archer" Michaels is not an imitation. Put this card into play next to the act deck.
Forced - After you draw the Lt. "Archer" Michaels story asset from the scanning deck: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.name: Evidence (MU-D12 "Mudbug")
cards.text:
Although the medical robot "Mudbug" is not fully sentient, whatever is corrupting the vessel could still have infected its systems and infiltrate aboard your ship. Thankfully, the Nostalgia II's central mainframe's anti-virus programs are able to confirm that none of the medical robot's systems have been corrupted
MU-D12 "Mudbug" is not an imitation. Put this card into play next to the act deck.
Forced - After you draw the MU-D12 "Mudbug" story asset from the scanning deck: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.name: Evidence (Sophie)
cards.text:
With the mainframe's help, you track down the source of the ship's distress call -- an engineer that has been fixing ventilation problems and who has been stuck in the maintenance areas of the ship ever since her partner mysteriously disappeared during the initial outbreak. She was able to send out a distress beacon by hacking into the comms system. You note that it was impossible for the contagion to reach her while she was in the maintenance areas.
Sophie is not an imitation. Put this card into play next to the act deck.
Forced - After you draw the Sophie story asset from the scanning deck: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.name: Another's Woe
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After an [[Ally]] asset leaves play: Place 1 doom on Another's Woe. [action] Test [willpower] (3) or [agility] (3): If you succeed, discard Another's Woe.

cards.name: Contamination
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Contamination to an [[Ally]] asset at your location (unique if possible). Forced - At the end of the round, you must either (choose one): Discard attached [[Ally]], or place 1 doom on it.

cards.flavor: "Am I still human?"
cards.name: Corrupted Machine
cards.text: Spawn - Location with the most clues. [action] Parley. Test [willpower] (3): If you succeed, discard Corrupted Machine. If you fail, it immediately attacks you.

cards.flavor: "It's all around us, Jesus!"
cards.name: From the Dark
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each card in the scanning deck. If you fail, either take 1 damage for each point you fail by, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Mimic enemy and draw it.

cards.flavor: Anyone devoid of hope has ceased to belong to the future.
cards.name: Hopeless
cards.text: Revelation - Put Hopeless into play in your threat area. Forced - When the agenda advances: Discard Hopeless and test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror for each [[Crew]] story asset at your location.

cards.name: Infection
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play in your threat area. As an additional cost to move or perform "[action]" abilities, take 1 damage. Forced - At the end of your turn: Discard Infection.

cards.flavor: Help.
cards.name: Mimic
cards.text:
Mimic gains the traits of the topmost [[Ally]] asset in your discard pile.
Mimic deals additional horror equal to the sanity value of the topmost [[Ally]] asset in your discard pile.

cards.name: Pale Blue Dot
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Pale Blue Dot to your current location. Forced - After you leave attached location, you must either (choose one): Take 1 horror, or add 1 doom to the current agenda and discard this card. This effect may cause the agenda to advance.

cards.flavor: "If I was an imitation, a perfect imitation, how would you know if it was really me?"
cards.name: Perfect Imitation
cards.text: Revelation - Put Perfect Imitation into play in your threat area. Forced - When you draw a Mimic enemy while you control an [[Ally]] asset: Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, discard this card and an [[Ally]] asset you control.

cards.flavor: A horde of cruel things skitters forth in an undulating wave of claws, teeth, and mottled... fur?
cards.name: Rats?
cards.text: Hunter. Forced - After you defeat Rats?: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.name: Scrambled
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Shuffle the scanning deck. If the top card of the scanning deck has an icon matching your current location, take 1 damage.

cards.name: Strange Moons
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2. If you fail, deal 1 damage to a [[Brain]] story asset.
[cultist]: -2. If you revealed another chaos token during this test, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: Reveal 2 additional tokens for this test.
[elder_thing]: -3. If this is an attack or evasion attempt against a [[Byakhee]] enemy, reveal an additional token for this test.

cards.name: Strange Moons
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3. If you fail, deal 1 damage to the nearest [[Brain]] story asset.
[cultist]: -3. If you revealed another chaos token during this test, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: Reveal 2 additional tokens for this test.
[elder_thing]: -4. If this is an attack or evasion attempt against a [[Byakhee]] enemy, reveal an additional token for this test.

cards.flavor:
<center>"Titan! to whose immortal eyes,
The sufferings of mortality,
Seen in their sad reality,
Were not as things that gods despise..."
<right>-- Lord Byron, Prometheus
cards.name: Moons of Saturn
