cards.text: Do not draw cards from the encounter deck during the mythos phase.

cards.name: Conspiracy Theory
cards.text:
The thick atmospheric pressure of Titan crushes you down into the ground. The Grey alien waits patiently in the tunnel, observing your every move. You realize that the alien appears to be completely immobile -- as if it were a cardboard cut-out.
Add 1 tally mark under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log. Flip this agenda back to agenda 1a.

cards.flavor: The hard, white speck of the Sun shines brighter now, drowning out the rest of the stars, paling them and thinning them out. The harsh atmosphere permeates throughout the Mi-Go facility.
cards.name: Signs from Aldebaran
cards.text: Forced - When a [[Brain]] story asset is defeated: Remove it from the game and add 1 tally mark under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log.

cards.name: They Came from Above!
cards.text:
A roar of no creature on Earth resounds throughout the facility. A myriad of flying wings blot out the sun, swooping towards the facility. The lights within the chambers take on a darker, blueish hue -- what you assume must be the Mi-Go's equivalent to an alarm. You realize now that you are in the midst of an interstellar assault.
Shuffle the set aside Interstellar Predators encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. This set is indicated by the following icon: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Byakhee]] enemy is discarded. Spawn it at the Entrance Tunnel.

cards.flavor: The large creatures, with membranous wings and webbed feet spiral down towards the facility -- ready to strike at any moment..
cards.name: Flight of the Byakhees
cards.text: Forced - When a [[Brain]] story asset is defeated: Remove it from the game and add 1 tally mark under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log.

cards.flavor: "Then Haïta cowered in his cave, his face hidden in his hands, and prayed that he alone might be punished for his sins and the world saved from destruction."
cards.name: Haïta
cards.text: Spawn - Entrance Tunnel. Aloof. Retaliate. Hunter. Forced - When you would evade a [[Byakhee]] enemy at Haïta's location: Deal 2 damage to Haïta instead.

cards.flavor: More and more of the winged fiends descend along the glare of the sun. The number of predators is only increasing by the minute. Soon you will be completely overwhelmed.
cards.name: Against the Sun
cards.text: Forced - When a [[Brain]] story asset is defeated: Remove it from the game and add 1 tally mark under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log. (Hint: The scenario will not end when this agenda advances.)

cards.name: They are Everywhere!
cards.text:
The alien forces do not stop. More and more they descend -- you can hear nothing other than the constant flattering of their hideous wings and the shrill of their beaks. It feels as though every time you fend off one of them, another two arrive in its place.
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until 1 [per_investigator] [[Byakhee]] enemies are discarded. Spawn them all at the Entrance Tunnel. Flip this agenda back to agenda 4a.

cards.flavor: A small, slender, non-threatening humanoid with large eyes and a round, bald head guards the entrance of the facility. They do not speak -- only ogles you from afar.
cards.name: First Encounter
cards.text: You cannot leave the Entrance Tunnel. Objective - If there are 1[per_investigator] clues on this act, or after The Greys is defeated, advance.

cards.name: The Fungi from Yuggoth
cards.text:
The Grey alien suddenly dissolves into an array of light -- you realize now that it was only a hologram. A large crustacean-like entity crawls out of the shadows from behind it. You remember these aliens, the Mi-Go, who will often use manufactured disguises when dealing with humans, to appear less threatening. Another hologram animates into life. It exhibits the shapes of several humans exchanging jars of brains for stacks of golden plates and other minerals. This must have been a recording of the cultists' "negotiations". With its fungoid arms, the alien gestures towards the strange facility, as if inviting you in.
Flip The Greys to its other side (transfer any damage tokens on it to its other side). Each investigator with 3 or fewer "Memories" takes 1 horror. Advance to agenda 2a and act 2a. Do not remove doom from play. Move all doom from agenda 1 to agenda 2a. Add 2 doom to agenda 2a for each tally mark under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log.

cards.flavor: This outpost appears to be a human brain storage facility of some kind. Perhaps using the Mi-Go's machines to scan the brains obtained by the cultists will help determine Fragment's whereabouts.
cards.name: Secrets of the Mind
cards.text: Forced - If a [[Simulation]] location has no clues on it: Add it to the victory display. Objective -- Find as much information as possible from the brain cylinders in the facility. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: Over the Moon
cards.text:
If the current agenda is agenda 3 or agenda 4:
You sneak out of the facility while the extraterrestrial swarm is distracted and return to your vessel. Behind you, a large translucent shield covers the entrance to the tunnel. Within moments, the Mi-Go facility begins its retaliation -- a spew of green gas releases into the facility, eradicating the remaining predators.
(→R2)
Otherwise:
With all the information you could attain from the alien facility, you scurry back into your landing vessel and return to the Tatterdemalion.
(→R2)

cards.flavor: The alien inscriptions on this cylinder have faded away -- this one must be decades old.
cards.name: Brain Cylinder 089

cards.flavor: A cursory translation of the inscription reveals that this brain has been deemed 'unusable'.  You wonder what that means.
cards.name: Brain Cylinder 114

cards.flavor: On the glass of this cylinder is marked an obviously human inscription -- the symbol you've come to known as the Yellow Sign.
cards.name: Brain Cylinder 367

cards.flavor: The iconic and archetypal image of an extraterrestrial as humans have imagined for centuries.
cards.name: The Greys
cards.text: Aloof. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] + [intellect] (3). Reveal and resolve an additional chaos token for this skill test. If you succeed, place 1 clue on the current act (from the token bank).

cards.name: Mi-Go Scientist
cards.text: Aloof. Patrol (any connecting location). [free] Exhaust Mi-Go Scientist: Resolve an [action] ability on Mi-Go Scientist's location, ignoring its '[action]' cost. Investigators at any location may trigger this ability.

cards.name: Brain Storage
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Brain Storage: Attach each set aside [[Brain]] story asset to it. [action] Choose a [[Brain]] story asset in play: Attach the chosen asset to any [[Interface]] location.

cards.flavor: A high-ceilinged chamber with walls covered with shadowy lattices. Ghostly light filters dust-filled air. Atmosphere turning the color of blood.
cards.name: Alien Chambers
Communicator
cards.text: [action]: Scan. Search the scanning deck for a card with both this location's icon and the icon on a [[Brain]] story asset attached to this location. Draw it. Limit 2 [[Brain]] story assets attached to this location.

cards.flavor: A high-ceilinged chamber with walls covered with shadowy lattices. Ghostly light filters dust-filled air. Atmosphere turning the color of blood.
cards.name: Alien Chambers
Dream Diagnostics
cards.text: [action] If Reality Simulator is in play: Scan. Search the scanning deck for a card with both this location's icon and the icon on a [[Brain]] story asset attached to this location. Draw it. If it is a location, put that card into play on top of Reality Simulator. Limit 2 [[Brain]] story assets attached to this location.

cards.flavor: A high-ceilinged chamber with walls covered with shadowy lattices. Ghostly light filters dust-filled air. Atmosphere turning the color of blood.
cards.name: Alien Chambers

cards.flavor: The caverns between the cliffs gleam in a slick and bio-mechanical texture -- undoubtedly artificial, but unlike any architecture you've ever seen.
cards.name: Entrance Tunnel
cards.text: [action]: Resign. Return to the Tatterdemalion with all of your findings.

cards.flavor: A high-ceilinged chamber with walls covered with shadowy lattices. Ghostly light filters dust-filled air. Atmosphere turning the color of blood.
cards.name: Entrance Tunnel
Memory Scanner
cards.text: [action] If Reality Simulator is in play: Scan. Search the scanning deck for a card with both this location's icon and the icon on a [[Brain]] story asset attached to this location. Draw it. If it is a location, put that card into play on top of Reality Simulator. Limit 2 [[Brain]] story assets attached to this location.

cards.flavor: A high-ceilinged chamber with walls covered with shadowy lattices. Ghostly light filters dust-filled air. Atmosphere turning the color of blood.
cards.name: Alien Chambers

cards.flavor: The Mi-Go have perfected this advanced form of augmented reality -- a machine capable of recreating any dream and memory.
cards.name: Reality Simulator
cards.text: (Reminder - Reality Simulator is not in play while there is a card on top of it)

cards.flavor: A high-ceilinged chamber with walls covered with shadowy lattices. Ghostly light filters dust-filled air. Atmosphere turning the color of blood.
cards.name: Alien Chambers

cards.flavor: When news broke out that the rioting was approaching the school, most of the children had already been hid.
cards.name: A Hiding Place
cards.text: While the investigator controlling K2-PS187 is at this location, reduce its shroud by 2.

cards.flavor: The mutiny did not go as planned -- the fringe cultists who opposed the awakening of Tassilda were quickly outnumbered and slaughtered -- but their brains would be kept.
cards.name: A Mutiny
cards.text: [action] Deal 1 damage to Brain Cylinder 367: Each investigator at this location adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories". (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: There is nothing as frightening as knowing your inevitable demise, without any hope of recovery.
cards.name: Adrift in Space
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal a +1, 0 or [elder_sign] token while investigating this location: Reveal and resolve an additional chaos token for this skill test.

cards.flavor: Their last real memory was just another monotonous day at work -- the dangerous labor of collecting raw asteroidal material, a few tethers away from drifting into space.
cards.name: An Accident
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal a [cultist] token during a skill test at this location: Take 1 damage.

cards.flavor: It feels like a dream you've had before.
cards.name: City of Cats
cards.text: [action] Parley. Discard 1 card of each cardtype (asset, event, and skill) from your hand: Heal 1 mental trauma. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.name: Fever Dream
cards.text: As an additional cost to investigate Fever Dream, commit all eligible skill cards in your hand to that investigation. Forced - When Fever Dream is added to the victory display: Record in your Campaign Log that you have witnessed the unconscious pandemonium.

cards.name: The Cultist
cards.text:
When the communicator crackles into life, it sounds the murmured hymns of a chant. You realize that this brain must have belonged to one of the cultists.
If you have 4 or more "Memories":
You try to remind the cultist of the sacred mission to awaken the royal princess of Carcosa. To your surprise, they denounce the existence of Tassilda -- they believe that only the inevitable Hastur could direct the great play that is the universe.
Add 1 tally mark under Impending Doom in your Campaign Log. Add this card to the victory display.
Otherwise:
When you try to ask for information about Fragment, they only laugh at you, claiming that you are too late, for the King in Yellow has already arrived.
Shuffle this card back into the scanning deck. Victory 1.

cards.name: The Miner
cards.text:
When the communicator connects to the brain cylinder, all you hear is screaming. "AHHHH! I'm falling! I'm falling!" Perhaps the disembodiment was too much for the fragile human mind to grasp.
If Adrift in Space is in the victory display:
You gently convince them that they are no longer drifting through space -- that they are finally at rest. Somehow, the voice is relieved and sighs. When you ask about the cultists that abducted them, they tell you all that they remember.
Add this card to the victory display.
Otherwise:
You try to calm them down and ask them about the cultists, but they never stop screaming.
Take 1 horror and shuffle this card back into the scanning deck. Victory 1.

cards.name: The Teacher
cards.text:
A hazy voice sounds out of the machine and introduces themselves as an elementary school teacher -- they had been abducted by the cultists over a hundred years ago during the great cataclysm.
If A Hiding Place is in the victory display:
You jog their memory by recounting the events of their abduction. They describe hearing news of the cultists spreading biological agents of some sort throughout the streets during the riots.
Add this card to the victory display.
Otherwise:
They can't remember much of the events that happened so many years ago. In a dream-like daze, the voice wishes you the best of luck.
Heal 1 horror and shuffle this card back into the scanning deck. Victory 1.

cards.name: Alien Aid
cards.text: Revelation - Put Alien Aid into play into your threat area. [free] Take 2 horror: If Mi-Go Scientist is in play, you may ready it and move it to any location. Discard Alien Aid.

cards.name: Close Encounters
cards.text: Revelation - Put Close Encounters into play in your threat area. Forced - When you reveal a chaos token while attacking or evading an enemy: Discard Close Encounters and reveal an additional chaos token.

cards.name: Innocent Mishap
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Deal 1 damage to the nearest [[Brain]] story asset. - Deal 2 damage to Mi-Go Scientist. - Take 2 direct damage.

cards.flavor: Language is the foundation of civilization. It is the glue that holds a people together. It is the first weapon drawn in a conflict.
cards.name: Lost in Translation
cards.text: Revelation - Put Lost in Translation into play in your threat area and seal a '0' or [elder_sign] token from the chaos bag on it. [action] [action]: Discard Lost in Translation.

cards.flavor: You don't want to know.
cards.name: Mi-Go Experiments
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] + [willpower] (3). Reveal and resolve an additional chaos token for this skill test. For each point you fail by, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: A cruel pest skitters forth in an undulating wave of claws, teeth, and mottled scales.
cards.name: Parasite
cards.text: Cannot be disengaged.

cards.name: Simulation Discrepancy
cards.text: Revelation - Put Simulation Discrepancy into play in your threat area. Forced - When you would discover any amount of clues: Discover 1 fewer clue, take 1 horror, and discard Simulation Discrepancy instead.

cards.name: Toxic Pits
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] + [agility] (3). Reveal and resolve an additional chaos token for this skill test. If you fail, deal 1 damage to each investigator, asset, and enemy at your location.

cards.flavor:
"There flapped rhythmically a horde of tame, trained, hybrid winged things... not altogether crows, nor buzzards, nor ants, [...] but something I cannot and must not recall."
-H.P. Lovecraft, The Festival
cards.name: Extraterrestrial Assault
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (6). For each point you fail by, discard the top card of the encounter deck. Draw each enemy discarded by this effect.

cards.name: Stalking Byakhee
cards.text: Spawn - Entrance Tunnel. Hunter. Alert. Forced - After Stalking Byakhee attacks you: Move it to the connecting location with the fewest investigators.

cards.name: Vicious Byakhee
cards.text: Spawn - Entrance Tunnel. Patrol (nearest location with a [[Brain]] attached). Forced - At the start of the enemy phase, if Vicious Byakhee is ready: Deal 2 damage to each [[Mi-Go]] enemy and [[Brain]] story asset at its location.

cards.name: The Machine in Yellow
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half of your "Memories" (rounded down).
[cultist]: -X. X is the number of hidden cards in your hand.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. Double that token's modifier.
[elder_thing]: -4. You may choose to cross out a tally mark next to your investigator's "Memories" to automatically succeed.

cards.name: The Machine in Yellow
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is your "Memories".
[cultist]: -X. X is the number of hidden cards in your hand.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. Double that token's modifier.
[elder_thing]: -6. You may choose to cross out a tally mark next to your investigator's "Memories" to automatically succeed.

cards.flavor: The theatre is eerily silent. The old wooden floor creaks beneath your feet, and a light rain gently patters on the roof as you explore the auditorium. There are rotting corpses among the seats, and the rest of the crowd has vanished…
cards.name: The Third Act
cards.text: [reaction] When you would take any amount of horror: You may cross out 1 tally mark from your "Memories" instead.

cards.name: Personal Fears
cards.text:
It doesn't surprise you to hear the voices of your distant friends, family members hum throughout the theatre. Flashes of your childhood and dreams glimmer between the crumbling walls of the theatre. Although your simulated mindscape contains all of your dear memories, it will also shelter your shortcomings and failures. All of your past enemies, accidents, and regrets blares sonorously from all around you.
Each investigator may search their deck and discard pile for a player card and draw it. Each investigator must search their deck and discard pile for a weakness and draw it (signature if possible.)

cards.flavor: Your mind is unravelling every thread of the past you remember into the virtual dreamscape of Ward Theatre. You are slowly drifting into insanity.
cards.name: A Nightmare
cards.text: [reaction] When you would take any amount of horror: You may cross out 1 tally mark from your "Memories" instead.

cards.name: It Returns
cards.text:
Check the Campaign Log. If you fully restored the sanity of K2-PS187:
A giggling laughter echoes through the halls. It couldn't be... You thought you defeated the Boogeyman, but it appears that it had been hiding within your memories, waiting for the right time to strike. "You've got nowhere to hide now! AHA-HA!" The clown's laughter sears into your mind. Pain pounds in your forehead, and blood runs from your ears.
Search the collection for The Boogeyman (Virtual Nightmare) and spawn it at the location furthest from all investigators.
Otherwise:
Abruptly, the malformed body of an unnatural nightmare slams into the theatre, its slithering tendrils reaching into the halls. It opens its maw and lets out a shrill, piercing song. The melody is uncanny; the notes sear into your mind. Pain pounds in your forehead, and blood runs from your ears.
Search the collection for Royal Emissary (Messenger from Aldebaran) and spawn it at the location furthest from all investigators.

cards.flavor: You feel your mind crumbling under the weight of the simulation. You don't have much time left before you lose track of your memories.
cards.name: Out of Mind
cards.text: [reaction] When you would take any amount of horror: You may cross out 1 tally mark from your "Memories" instead. Forced - After you add doom to any card in play (including this agenda): Each investigator takes 2 direct horror.

Madness. noun. mad.ness. |'mad-nəs.| The state of being mentally ill, especially severely. - Extremely foolish behavior. - A state of frenzied or chaotic activity. - There is no reason to flip to agenda 3b. - You may heal up to 1 mental trauma. (Group limit once per game.) - Didn't expect that, did you? - Flip back to agenda 3a.

cards.flavor: You pinch yourself to see if you are dreaming, and sure enough, your skin does not sting.  However strange it may be, delving into your mind is the only way to learn the truth of the matter.
cards.name: Awakening?
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter Backstage, investigators in the Theatre must spend 2[per_investigator] clues, as a group. Objective - After an investigator reveals the Backstage, advance.

cards.name: The Stranger
cards.text: Spawn - Furthest location from all investigators. Aloof. Hunter. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at The Stranger's location or a connecting location: Resolve the Forced effect of each hidden card in your hand (ignoring the conditions).

cards.flavor: A man in an elegant black suit awaits you in the halls behind the stage, his face covered by a pale mask. You instantly recognize the actor who played the role of the Stranger -- one of the characters from The King in Yellow. He turns and disappears through an open doorway, as if taunting you to follow.
cards.name: The Man in the Pallid Mask
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate or discover clues at The Stranger's location: Deal 2 damage to it. (Limit once per turn.) Objective - After The Stranger is defeated, advance.

cards.name: No Mask? No Mask!
cards.text:
As you face off with the Stranger, you get the sense that he is grinning beneath his pale, faceless mask. "Where is Fragment?" you ask, but he does not respond. "Who are you?" He remains silent, but brings his gloved hand up and slowly removes his mask, revealing a mirror image of yourself. "Who are you?" the doppelgänger asks threateningly. You step back in shock -- and your other self steps back in accordance. You point towards it - and it responds in kind. The stranger appears to mimic your every move.
Put a copy of the set aside Your Other Self into play in each investigator's threat area. Check your Campaign Log. If you have uncovered the cultists' inhuman methods, each investigator may either (choose one): - Gain 1 clue from the token bank and heal up to 2 damage and 2 horror. - Add 1 tally mark next to their "Memories".

cards.flavor: It is finally time to face your past. You must overcome the cultist within you to uncover the whereabouts of Tassilda's palace.
cards.name: Unmasked
cards.text: Forced - When an investigator is defeated, if there is a copy of Your Other Self in their threat area: That copy is defeated as well. Objective - If there are no copies of Your Other Self in play, and at least 1 investigator is undefeated, advance.

cards.name: Stealing the Show
cards.text:
The other you falls down to the ground in defeat. You have finally vanquished your demons. The doppelgänger cries out in defiance. "You don't know what you are fighting. Within the palaces of Carcosa, after we freed the princess, we uncovered the true nature of Hastur, and it is greater than any one of us could have imagined... it is inevitable..." You watch as your other self disintegrates into ashen dust and dissipate into the air...
(→R2)

cards.name: Your Other Self
cards.text: Cannot be disengaged (but can be exhausted). Your Other Self's fight, health and evade values are equal to the engaged investigator's base [combat], health, and [agility] values. Forced - When you deal damage to Your Other Self, if it is ready: The engaged investigator also takes that amount of damage. You may spend 1 clue to cancel that damage.

cards.flavor: The Daemon of the Valley knows not why its waters are red, nor whither they are bound.
cards.name: Daemon of Nis
cards.text: Prey - Most "Memories" only. Hunter. Alert. Forced - When Daemon of Nis attacks you: Cross out 1 tally mark next to your "Memories".

cards.name: Dark Reflections (Malingerer)
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - After you reshuffle your deck because there are no cards in it: Discard this card and take 3 horror. [reaction] At the start of the investigator phase, choose an investigator to lose 2 actions and draw the top card of the encounter deck: Discard Dark Reflections (Malingerer).

cards.name: Dark Reflections (Murderer)
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - After you reshuffle your deck because there are no cards in it: Discard this card and take 3 horror. [action] Discard an [[Ally]] asset controlled by an investigator at your location: Discard Dark Reflections (Murderer).

cards.name: Dark Reflections (Sycophant)
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - After you reshuffle your deck because there are no cards in it: Discard this card and take 3 damage. [action] Choose an investigator at your location to spend 4 resources: Discard this card.

cards.name: Dark Reflections (Zealot)
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - After you reshuffle your deck because there are no cards in it: Discard this card and take 3 damage. [action] Choose an investigator at your location to choose and discard 3 cards from their hand: Discard Dark Reflections (Zealot).

cards.name: Delusional Madness
cards.text: Peril. Surge. Revelation - Secretly move a hidden card from your hand to another investigator's hand, if possible.

cards.flavor: It is what you haven't done that will torment you.
cards.name: Fathomless Regrets
cards.text: Revelation - Discard the top X cards of your deck. X is your "Memories". Draw each weakness discarded by this effect. If no weaknesses were drawn, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: Promises are bound to be broken.
cards.name: Forbidding Promises
cards.text: Revelation - Discard the top X cards of your deck. X is your "Memories". For each copy of a card in your hand that you discarded, discard that card from your hand. If no copies were discarded, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: You feel your thoughts slipping away -- perhaps your other self is trying to hide something in the forgotten.
cards.name: Persistence of Memory
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror for each point you fail by and cross out 1 tally mark next to your "Memories".

cards.name: Perspective Switch
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - After you discard a hidden card from your hand: Discard Perspective Switch, disengage from all enemies and move to the revealed location farthest from your current location.

cards.flavor: Who are you?
cards.name: Spirit of Than
cards.text: Prey - Least "Memories" only. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When Spirit of Than attacks you, it deals +1 horror for every 2 of your "Memories".

cards.name: Fragment of Carcosa
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2. If you fail while you are at a [[Cave]] location, take 1 damage.
[cultist]: -2.  If you fail while you are at a [[Carcosa]] location, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: -1. You must either (choose one): Reveal another token, or cross out 1 tally mark next to your "Memories".
[elder_thing]: -2. If you are at a [[Carcosa]] location: Add 1 doom to the current agenda, or automatically fail this skill test.

cards.name: Fragment of Carcosa
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3. If you are at a [[Cave]] location, take 1 damage.
[cultist]: -3. If you are at a [[Carcosa]] location, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: -2. You must either (choose one): Reveal another token, or cross out 1 tally mark next to your "Memories".
[elder_thing]: -3. If you are at a [[Carcosa]] location: Add 1 doom to the current agenda, or automatically fail this skill test.

cards.flavor: Although your scanners have not detected any anomalies within Fragment, stepping down onto the surface still invokes a sense of dread like no other. You can't help but feel like something horrible will happen if you take too long dawdling around.
cards.name: The Shadows Lengthen
cards.text: There is no doom threshold (keep adding doom to this agenda).

Entropy. noun.en.tro.py |'en-trə-pē.| The degree of disorder or uncertainty in a system - The degradation of the matter and energy in the universe to an ultimate state of inert uniformity - A process of degradation or a trend to disorder - Chaos, disorganisation, randomness. - You aren't supposed to see this. - (Hint: "Time is a flat circle. Everything we have done or will do we will do over and over and over again -- forever.")

cards.flavor: Your landing must have disturbed the pocket reality hidden within Fragment. The entire asteroid is beginning to collapse and soon you will be trapped within. Get out of here while you still can!
cards.name: Shall Dry and Die
cards.text: Surface of Fragment gains: "[action]: Resign."

cards.name: Mad Carcosa
cards.text:
You couldn't all make it out in time -- the vortex of the pocket dimension sucks you and your companions back into the yellow palace. When the trembling finally ends, you exit to the palace to find yourself in a warped, alien city. Its twisting streets and aberrant architecture have no semblance of order or structure. In the distance, a murky lake reflects the glare of two suns. You are trapped within Carcosa.
(→R2)

cards.flavor: During the descent, the glimmer of a man-made structure could be seen in the distance, the remnants of the prior cultist expedition. They must have left traces as to how to enter the grand palace.
cards.name: In Lost Carcosa
cards.text: Objective - If Abandoned Lander is revealed and there are no clues on it, advance.

cards.name: Where All Is Lost
cards.text:
Hidden within a compartment of the abandoned shuttle is a two-sided map of the asteroid created by the cultists during their initial exploration. On one side of the map, there are drawings of vast and tunneling caverns spreading throughout the interior of Fragment. When you flip it over to its other side, the map depicts something else instead -- a grand palace, with hallways replacing tunnels and majestic chambers in the place of subterranean cavities. It appears that there are certain weaknesses in the veil of reality that allow the explorers to temporarily shift certain places into the dimension known as Carcosa.
If the investigators have watched Heir to Carcosa:
The rooms of the palace depicted on the map... they are the same ones that were portrayed in the virtual play. You take the map with you and head towards the entrance of the caverns - the entrance to the realm of Carcosa.
Each investigator gains 1 clue from the token bank. Put all set aside two-sided locations into play, [[Cave]] side face up.
Otherwise:
Studying the map for a while does not register any memories. You take the map with you and begin the search for the caverns - the entrance to the realm of Carcosa.
Put all set aside two-sided locations into play, [[Cave]] side face up. Spawn the set-aside Beast of Aldebaran enemy in the Cyclopean Caverns.

cards.flavor: You must find and confront Tassilda in this reality defying asteroid before she is elevated by her father and spreads the madness of Carcosa throughout the colonies.
cards.name: The Heir to Carcosa
cards.text: [free] If you are at a [[Cave]] or [[Carcosa]] location, spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Flip your location and all connecting locations to their other side. Objective - Find the Royal Princess of Carcosa. (You will be instructed when to advance).

cards.name: The End
cards.text:
You will never know if Tassilda was real -- but what you have learned from these cultists, is that the arcane ritual that supposedly released her has also accelerated the increasing entropy of the universe. In fact, K2-PS187 announced that with the new constants in play, the Sun itself will implode in just a few more years, and annihilate everything within a few light years. You search the cultists for any methods to reverse this action, but find no solutions to this impossible puzzle. The only hope left is to try to survive the supernova and save as many as you can. As you contemplate your next steps, the entire asteroid begins trembling, and an inhuman roar echoes through the halls and caverns behind you.
Advance to agenda 2a and act 3a. Do not remove doom from play. Move all doom from agenda 1 to agenda 2a. Spawn the set aside Cave Dweller enemy at the Abandoned Lander.

cards.flavor: You won't be able to warn anyone of the impending doom if you don't get out of this one alive. You must escape this asteroid as soon as you can!
cards.name: The Unspeakable Truth
cards.text: [free] If you are at a [[Cave]] or [[Carcosa]] location, spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Flip your location and all connecting locations to their other side. Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: Back to Reality
cards.text:
If each undefeated investigator has resigned:
You hang on tight as the shuttle lifts off the asteroid moments before it crumbles into itself -- leaving only a puff of yellow dust in its wake.
(→R3)
Otherwise (if you were instructed to advance by a card other than act 3a):
Among the hieroglyphs of the caverns and paintings that adjourn the halls of the palace, you learn of an obscure ritual that will temporarily deny Tassilda's claim to the throne -- which may provide enough time for humanity to escape. However, you still need to get out of here first.
Record in your Campaign Log that you know of the Abjuration of the Throne. Flip this card back over to act 3a.

cards.name: Bottle of Whispers
cards.text:
Fast.
[reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals an [auto_fail] token, remove Bottle of Whispers from the game: Cancel that token and treat it as an [elder_sign] token instead.

cards.flavor: You remember now that there was one survey team that never left the asteroid -- the team that awakened Tassilda. Is this their shuttle?
cards.name: Abandoned Lander
cards.text:
Cannot be flipped.
While investigating this location, reduce the shroud by 1 for each tally mark next to your "Memories".

cards.flavor: You spot a single structure you recognize as a landing shuttle. This must be where the cultists set up their survey base camp when they were first arrived.
cards.name: Abandoned Lander

cards.flavor: The rocky surface is soft to the touch, covered by the ever-so light layer of golden dust. Every gravity-less step you take imprints your footprint into the ground.
cards.name: Surface of Fragment
cards.text: Cannot be flipped.

cards.flavor: The crooked cliffs and dusty craters do not suggest anything artificial. By all accounts it appears to be natural.
cards.name: Surface of Fragment

cards.flavor: Now, how do we get down there?
cards.name: Bottomless Pit
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Bottomless Pit: Move to any other non-[[Surface]] location, take 3 direct damage and lose all remaining actions.

cards.flavor: Only a few more steps...
cards.name: Spiral Staircase
cards.text: Forced - When Spiral Staircase flips: Move each investigator at Spiral Staircase to a connecting location.

cards.name: Cyclopean Caverns
cards.text: [free] Investigators at this location cross out 1[per_investigator] tally marks next to their "Memories", as a group: Choose any [[Cave]] or [[Carcosa]] location and flip it to its other side.

cards.flavor: There is no one here - only statues and paintings to greet you.
cards.name: Grand Ballroom
cards.text: [free] If this location is the only [[Carcosa]] location in play: Read the set aside "Arrival of the King" story card. (Max once per game.)

cards.flavor: A crack in the slab, hidden within the vast sculptures of the asteroid. The passage leads to a dark and complex system of caverns underneath the surface.
cards.name: Hidden Passage

cards.flavor: The beautiful and decorated entrance to the palace of our royal family.
cards.name: Palace Gates
cards.text: You cannot resign while Palace Gates is in play.

cards.flavor: Abnormally cold air siphons through the cavity, chilling you to the core.
cards.name: Ice Cavity
cards.text: Ice Cavity gets -1 shroud for each connecting [[Cave]] location.

cards.name: Gardens of Thothut
cards.text:
Gardens of Thothut gets +1 shroud for each connecting [[Carcosa]] location.
[free] If this location is the only [[Carcosa]] location in play: Read the set aside "Delights" story card. (Max once per game.)

cards.name: Impassable Ravine
cards.text:
You cannot enter Impassable Ravine from connecting locations.
[free] If there are no [[Carcosa]] locations in play and each undefeated investigator is at this location: Read the set aside "Lost Expedition" story card. (Max once per game.)

cards.name: The Yellow Throne
cards.text: [free] If there are 6 [[Carcosa]] locations in play and each undefeated investigator is at this location: Read the set aside "Lost Expedition" story card. (Max once per game.)

cards.flavor: Stalagmites and stalactite adjourn this massive and particularly perilous underground pocket.
cards.name: Stalagmite Forest
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at this location: Take 1 damage.

cards.name: Labyrinths of Tasylock
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at this location: Take 1 horror. [free] If this location is the only [[Carcosa]] location in play: Read the set aside "For You Alone" story card. (Max once per game.)

cards.name: Arrival of the King
cards.text:
Standing and sitting in small groups around the ballroom, are statues of the inhabitants of the Palace. They are all gaily dressed for a masquerade, though they have all unmasked. On closer inspection, you realize the statues are speaking in low, stunned tones, as if time here has slowed almost to a standstill. They share amongst each other the faintest rumors about the Royal Family of Carcosa. It is an echo of the moment the city of Yhtill -- wherein the Palace lay -- became Carcosa, and the royal family of the palace learned that they were inevitably doomed. They stand around now, morose and uncertain. The people of the Palace were truly lost in both mind and soul.
Each investigator may cross out any amount of tally marks next to their "Memories". For every 2 [per_investigator] tally marks just crossed out, you may cross out 1 tally mark under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log. Add this card to the victory display. Victory 1.

cards.name: Delights
cards.text:
Within the gardens are plants that bear no resemblance to anything natural of Earth. Fruits of unrecognizable chromatics populate the obsidian towers of web-like silk. The scene describes a fever dream of inconceivable shapes and smells that extends across the very limits of your mind. You pick up one of the fruits that fell onto the floor to examine it, only to watch it rot and decay through your fingers. Time in the realm of Carcosa does not behave as it does in your dimension. When you finally exit the forbidden gardens, an air of relief overcomes you. Although you cannot describe the nature of what you experienced, it was nonetheless truly invigorating and you feel like you are finally in control of your own destiny.
You may choose and remove any non - [auto_fail] symbol token from the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign. Add this card to the victory display. Victory 1.

cards.name: For You Alone
cards.text:
The halls grow increasingly labyrinthine, the chambers, once brightly lit and spacious, grow dark and dusty and cramped. You further stray into the labyrinth until you reach a chamber with walls and columns covered in shelves. Each shelf has a glass bottle upon it, no two of which was alike in shape or design, and each bottle is inscribed with a name. There is an uncountable number of these flasks -- enough to account for every individual in the universe, human and non-human alike, past and future. Eventually, you come across single dark container sitting in the corner, beckoning you to come closer. You flip it over and see your own name scrawled on the bottom. This is your bottle. It was meant for you.
Search for the set-aside Bottle of Whispers weakness and add it to any investigator's hand. This card is added to their deck and does not count towards that investigator's deck size. Add this card to the victory display. Victory 1.

cards.name: Lost Expedition
cards.text:
If this is the the first time you read this:
Eventually, you come across the bodies of several cultists -- the missing survey team. They have abandoned their helmets and died from sudden fatal decompression. When you scan their notes, your worst fears have been confirmed. Tassilda no longer exists in this dimension, but has elevated into godhood and now resides along with her father, between the fabric of space time -- and within the core of all stars. And yet, there is a greater complication, for the survey team's notes also unmask the true nature of the King in Yellow. Our destruction gives it form, our violence gives it name, our screams give it a voice. It is no more of a deity than gravity is, no matter how many people worship and ascribe it a personality and an intelligence. It is the thermodynamic concept of Entropy itself that you face -- the gradual and inevitable decline of any system into absolute chaos. And, by all understanding of physics, there is no stopping it.
Regardless of if this is the first time you read this: Advance the current act and set this card aside, out of play.

cards.name: Broken Reality
cards.text: Revelation - Attach this card to a [[Cave]] or [[Carcosa]] location with the fewest clues without a copy of Broken Reality attached. Forced - After you flip the attached location: Flip it back to its original side and discard this card. [action] Spend 1 clue: Discard this card.

cards.flavor: "It's coming down! Run!"
cards.name: Cave Collapse
cards.text: Revelation - Each investigator at a [[Cave]] location must test [agility] (3). Each investigator who fails takes 1 damage and loses 1 action.

cards.flavor: A perversion of what used to be a human.
cards.name: Cave Dweller
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Hunter. Forced - When Cave Dweller's location is flipped: Exhaust Cave Dweller.

cards.name: Chosen by Him
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Chosen by Him to an [[Item,]] [[Spell]], or [[Ally]] asset you control that can leave play. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 2 direct damage and shuffle the attached asset back into your deck. [action]: Remove attached asset from the game.

cards.name: Echoes of Tassilda (Matter)
cards.text: Surge. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. [reaction] When an investigator would be defeated by damage: Cancel that damage and add this card to the victory display. (If you are not the only undefeated investigator remaining, that investigator cannot be you.)

cards.name: Echoes of Tassilda (Mind)
cards.text: Surge. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. [reaction] When an investigator would be defeated by horror: Cancel that horror and add this card to the victory display. (If you are not the only undefeated investigator remaining, that investigator cannot be you.)

cards.name: Hastur's Domain
cards.text: Revelation - Put Hastur's Domain into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After you flip any number of locations: Take 1 horror. [action]: Test [willpower] (3) or [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Hastur's Domain.

cards.flavor: It speaks to you.
cards.name: Irresistible Truths
cards.text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (3). If you are at a [[Carcosa]] location, you must commit all eligible skill cards to this test. If you fail, take 2 horror.

cards.name: Madness of Carcosa
cards.text: Surge. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. [reaction] After an investigator is defeated: Add this card to the victory display.

cards.name: Scene Shifting
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. - Move each enemy 1 location toward you. Each enemy at your location immediately attacks you.

cards.name: Song of Your Soul
cards.text: Revelation - Put Song of Your Soul into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of the round: For each event in your hand, either discard it or take 1 horror. Then, discard Song of Your Soul.

cards.flavor: ... and midnight sounded from the misty spires in the fog-wrapped city.
cards.name: Sophistic Spires
cards.text: Spawn - Nearest [[Carcosa]] location. Massive. Does not attack during the enemy phase.

cards.flavor: The scolloped tatters of the King in Yellow must hide Yhtill forever.
cards.name: Tattered Curtains
cards.text: Spawn - Nearest [[Carcosa]] location. Does not attack during the enemy phase. Forced - After you flip Tattered Curtains's location: Move it one location towards you.

cards.name: Unstable Dimension
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 2 damage and flip your current location to its other side. Then, discard this card. [action] Spend 2 resources: Discard this card.

cards.flavor: Sounding throughout the mists is a distant, familiar melody -- Cassilda's song.
cards.name: Yellow Mists
cards.text:
Aloof. Hunter.
Yellow Mists' location gains the [[Carcosa]] trait.

cards.name: Starfall
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of revealed locations without clues (rounded up). 
[cultist]: -3. If you fail by 2 or more, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[tablet]: Increase the difficulty of this skill test by 1. Reveal another token. 
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or take 1 horror for each point you fail by.

cards.name: Starfall
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of locations in play (rounded up).
[cultist]:  -4. If you fail by 2 or more, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[tablet]: Increase the difficulty of this skill test by 1. Reveal another token.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or take 1 horror for each point you fail by.

cards.flavor: The sun is getting hotter every day... There might not be enough time to save everyone. K2-PS187 has preemptively plotted the trajectories to the three major population centers within the solar system, but you will have to decide which ones to prioritise saving.
cards.name: Journey Across Space
cards.text: [free] During a skill test, cross out 1 tally mark next to your "Memories": Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1.

cards.flavor: The sun glares with unrivalled intensity in the night sky -- challenging and defeating all in a vicious battle for attention.
cards.name: Sol
cards.text: Revelation - Put this location into play. Forced - After you enter this location: You are immediately killed.

cards.flavor: Solar flares and radioactive emissions have been surging in frequency beyond expected fluctuations. Despite the increasingly dangerous environment, you carry on with your quest to save the future of humanity.
cards.name: Red Sun
cards.text: [free] During a skill test, cross out 1 tally mark next to your "Memories": Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1.

cards.name: Fall of Sol
cards.text:
Months have passed since you've begun your mission to save the various colonies. You've travelled between the planets and met many strange and interesting people. Some have been helpful, helping you get accustomed to the technology of the future, or pointing you towards the right direction. Most, however, have regarded you with suspicion and wariness because of the past you must unfortunately wear on your sleeves. The colonies of humanity scramble to survive the blast in any way possible. Many decide to launch their starships into deep space, hoping to escape the blast, even though the current generation of vessels do not have the speed necessary to escape the danger zone. The majority of colonists strive to make the most out of the last few years humanity has left.
Shuffle the set aside Hastur's Gaze encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. This set is indicated by the following icon:

cards.flavor: The end is nigh. The sun's core is decaying at an extraordinary rate. The billion years that humans once believed it had before the star sputters out and dies has been reduced to only a handful of months. There isn't much time left before your entire world is annihilated.
cards.name: Supernova
cards.text: [free] During a skill test, cross out 1 tally mark next to your "Memories": Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1.

cards.name: Death of the Sun
cards.text: You've run out of time. You can no longer make it to any of the shelters before the approaching apocalypse. All you can do is look up, and watch the majestic display. Each remaining investigator is defeated. (→R1)

cards.flavor: Forcefully removing Tassilda from the throne only delayed the imminent supernova and brought her attention to the colonies. She has taken the destruction of the solar system into her own hands. You must stop her before her madness consumes all!
cards.name: Dark Matter
cards.text: Forced - When a location has 3 or more horror on it: Remove it from the game. Each investigator at that location is defeated. Move all enemies at that location to the location with the most clues. Forced - If each investigator has resigned or has been defeated, advance. (Keep adding doom to this agenda.)

cards.name: Shadows and Darkness
cards.text:
A dark cloud covers all matter in the solar system, transforming the remaining colonies into madness and chaos. Without further interruptions, Tassilda returns to finish her work with Sol. A brilliant light shines over the solar system. The cataclysmic supernova radiates through the void, annihilating all unprotected life and stripping all the heavenly bodies of their precious atmosphere, leaving barren worlds in its wake. Despite all of your efforts, you could not redeem yourself and prevent the demise of humanity. In your finals moments, a figure in a tattered yellow dress materializes in the light. You kneel before her and grab onto her hand, as Tassilda welcomes you into the dark realm of Carcosa.
Each investigator is killed. The investigators lose the campaign. There is no resolution.

cards.flavor: Aboard the Tatterdemalion, you and your companions traverse the solar system to find a way to survive the blast and save as many as you can before the inevitable end.
cards.name: End Times
cards.text: [action]: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with an icon matching your current location and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck. Objective - Find and complete as many objectives as possible before the incoming supernova. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: The Wait...
cards.text:
You gather with the citizens of the colonies inside the underground shelters and pray that whatever plans the officials have come up with to endure the blast will succeed.
(→R1)

cards.flavor: Madness and chaos spreads across space. You must stop Tassilda at all cost.
cards.name: Tassilda's Awakening
cards.text: [action]: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with an icon matching your current location and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck. [action] Parley. Get help from the colonies. Place 1 of your clues onto the location with the most clues: Deal X damage to Tassilda. X is the number of story assets in the victory display. Objective - When Tassilda is defeated, advance.

cards.name: Finale
cards.text:
If Hope, Yuggoth and New Brooklyn have been removed from the game:
You have finally vanquished the fabled princess of Carcosa -- but at what cost?
Advance to agenda 1d. (Proceed to the back of the Dark Matter agenda.)
Otherwise:
It is finally over... The dark veil covering the solar system left behind by Tassilda's wake dissipates into space as the sun shines once more...
Proceed to (→R2).

cards.name: The Tatterdemalion
cards.text:
The Tatterdemalion is connected to attached location and vice versa. Moving to or from The Tatterdemalion does not cost an action ([free]).
[action]: Attach The Tatterdemalion to any location. Investigators at any location may activate this ability. (Limit once per investigator per round.)

cards.flavor: The Tatterdemalion is large, lumbering, and slow. The piloting, and most internal systems, are controlled by the cybernetic supercomputer K2-PS187.
cards.name: The Tatterdemalion

cards.flavor: Forged from the remains of mining outposts and scientific space stations, the UCC has one goal: The survival of humanity, at whatever cost.
cards.name: New Brooklyn
cards.text: [reaction] At the end of your turn: Heal 1 damage. [action]: Resign. Rejoin the United Colonial Coalition and try to live a normal life among the stars.

cards.flavor: The United Colonial Coalition lies within the asteroid belt between the planets Mars and Jupiter. This is where The Tatterdemalion was first constructed, before being reformed into a cultist ship.
cards.name: Asteroid Belt

cards.flavor: The first structure of the colony was assembled in 2050, shortly after the endtimes began. Despite the harsh conditions, the colony slowly grew into the great metropolis it is today.
cards.name: Hope
cards.text: [reaction] At the end of your turn: Heal 1 horror. [action]: Resign. Settle down within the last bastion of humanity and hope for the best.

cards.flavor: Many escaped to Mars on several Ark-class ships when the Ancient Ones destroyed Earth. Now, it is where most of humanity remains.
cards.name: Mars

cards.flavor: The sun shines there no brighter than a star, but the strange fungoid Mi-Go need no light.\
cards.name: Yuggoth
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Yuggoth: Spawn the set aside Mi-Go Sentinel at this location. During your turn, if you are at a [[Pluto]] location or a [[Starship]] location attached to a [[Pluto]] location, reveal and resolve an additional chaos token during skill tests you perform.

cards.flavor: Strange clicking noises can be heard emanating from the barren surface on specific frequencies. Scientists believe that there may be life on this dwarf planet.
cards.name: Pluto..?

cards.flavor:
You will receive no such niceties or mercies 
from my sire.
cards.name: Tassilda
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Tassilda gets +1[per_investigator] health for each tally mark under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log. Forced - After any amount of doom is placed on a card: For each doom placed, place 1 horror token on Tassilda's location and each connecting location.

cards.name: The Cassilda
cards.text:
The Cassilda is connected to attached location and vice versa. Moving to or from The Cassilda does not cost an action ([free]).
[free] Spend 2 resources: Attach The Cassilda to any location. Investigators at any location may activate this ability. (Limit once per investigator per round.)

cards.flavor: This experimental vessel possesses a ravenous anti-matter engine, giving it a high rate of acceleration/deceleration, designed to maximize speed and maneuverability.
cards.name: The Cassilda

cards.flavor: Little is known about the Great Race of Yith. Rumor has it their very advanced and evolved brains allows them to project their minds across time and space.
cards.name: Yithian Guard
cards.text: Forced - After you deal any amount of damage to Yithian Guard: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand.

cards.name: Mi-Go Sentinel
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Forced - After you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet] or [elder_thing] token at Mi-Go Sentinel's location: Move 1 of your clues onto Mi-Go Sentinel. Forced - When you defeat Mi-Go Sentinel: Take control of all of its clues.

cards.flavor: A massive alien entity the Mi-Go have been growing in the moon for centuries in an attempt to forestall the return of the Ancient Ones. When the earthling cultists released it, the moon began shifting its orbit -- waking the Ancient Ones.
cards.name: Domaag T’eel
cards.subname: The Mistake that Ended the World
cards.text: Massive. Forced - After you defeat Domaag T’eel: Gain 3[per_investigator] clues from the token bank.

cards.name: Earth
cards.text: Revelation - Put this location into play. Check your Campaign Log. Each investigator who has been corrupted by the Earth takes 2 damage. Forced - After you enter this location: You are immediately driven insane.

cards.flavor: A high-security scientific laboratory with a staff of hundreds of full-time live-in colonists.
cards.name: Mount Sinai
cards.text: Revelation - Put this location into play. Forced - When you would scan at Mount Sinai: Test [agility] (1). This test gets +2 difficulty for each clue on this location. If you fail, cancel that scan.

cards.flavor: The abandoned research vessel floats adrift at the edge of the solar system. There are no signs of any activity.
cards.name: Derelict Ship
cards.text: Revelation - Put this location into play. As an additional cost to scan at Derelict Ship, you must draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: Discovered in the late 21st century, xeno-archaeologists determined these ruins to be of Yithian origins.
cards.name: Martian Ruins
cards.text: Revelation - Put this location into play and spawn the set aside Yithian Guard at this location. You cannot scan Martian Ruins while there is a ready enemy at this location.

cards.flavor: Ever since the last Ark left, there has been no more radio signals received from our home planet.
cards.name: Olympus Telescope
cards.text: Revelation - Put this location into play. [action][action]: Investigate. Choose any revealed location. Investigate as if you were at that location.

cards.name: Moonbase Laboratory
cards.text: Revelation - Put this location into play. You cannot scan Moonbase Laboratory while there are clues on it. Forced - At the end of the round, if there is a [[Starship]] attached to this location: Place 1 resource on this location (to a maximum of 3). If there are 3 resources on it, spawn the set aside Domaag T’eel enemy at this location.

cards.name: Threshold of Yuggoth
cards.text: Revelation - Put this location into play. Forced - When you would scan at Threshold of Yuggoth: Reveal a random chaos token for each clue on Threshold of Yuggoth. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing] or [auto_fail] token, cancel that scan and take 1 horror instead.

cards.name: Ritual of the Sun
cards.text:
Check your Campaign Log. If you know of the Abjuration of the Throne:
After months of searching, you have finally uncovered the ritual site -- the sun itself. If you are to give the entire solar system a chance to thrive for a few more millennia before having to retreat, this ritual must be done.
Attach this card to Sol. Objective - Investigators at a connecting location must spend 9 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to complete the ritual. If you do so, replace the agenda deck and act deck with the set aside Dark Matter agenda and Tassilda's Awakening act, and spawn the set aside Tassilda enemy at Sol. Reduce the cost of the ritual by 2[per_investigator] for each of the following entries in your Campaign Log: - You witnessed the primordial chaos. - You witnessed the unconscious pandemonium. - You witnessed the manifested madness. (Beware -- Challenging the throne is no simple task and may doom the solar system to a worse fate.)
Otherwise:
Unfortunately, studying the sun does not yield any answers or promises as to how to prevent the supernova -- You must help humanity escape before it is too late.
Gain 1 [per_investigator] clues from the token bank. Remove this card from the game.

cards.flavor: The data required is reported to have been discovered somewhere along the edge of the solar system.
cards.name: Project Origami
cards.text: Revelation - Put Project Origami into play next to the act deck. Objective - Help the UCC escape by proving the formula to fold space-time. If an investigator at Mount Sinai controls Universal Archives: Remove it from the game and spend 2[per_investigator] clues, as a group, to add this card to the victory display.

cards.flavor: Rumor has it that the electromagnetic shileding technology has already been developed by humanity in certain secret laboratories.
cards.name: Last Hope
cards.text: Revelation - Put Last Hope into play next to the act deck. Objective - Find a way to protect Hope. If an investigator at Hope controls Shielding Device: Remove it from the game and spend 2[per_investigator] clues, as a group, to add this card to the victory display

cards.flavor: The strange beings of Mi-Go point out that members of the Great Race of Yith have been frequently spotted in Martian territories.
cards.name: Repairing the Threshold
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play next to the act deck. Objective - Help the Mi-Go travel back to their homeworld by returning the lost Yithian artifact. If an investigator at Threshold of Yuggoth controls Stasis Cube: Remove it from the game and spend 2[per_investigator] clues, as a group, to add this card to the victory display.

cards.flavor: The missing research vessel drifts somewhere in the solar system -- perhaps the Tatterdemalion's sensors could detect it.
cards.name: Ar-NO
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Ar-NO to Mount Sinai. Objective - If The Cassilda is attached to Mount Sinai: Remove Ar-NO from the game and put the set aside Project Origami story asset into play next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: With few remaining soldiers, Director Cixin requests your aid in defending against the assault of the Martians.
cards.name: Director Cixin
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Director Cixin to Hope. Objective - If Martian Crab is in the victory display: Remove Director Cixin from the game and put the set aside Last Hope story asset into play next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: The Mi-Go do not trust you after what you've done on Titan -- you must regain their cooperation by gathering 'information' from the lost lunar station.
cards.name: Mi-Go Collector
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Mi-Go Collector to Threshold of Yuggoth. Objective - If there are no clues on Moonbase Laboratory: Remove this card from the game and put the set aside Repairing the Threshold story asset into play next to the act deck.

cards.name: Shambler from the Stars
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Shambler from the Stars cannot be engaged except by the ability below. Forced - After you trigger an [action] ability at its location: Shambler from the Stars engages and attacks you. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: That's no asteroid.
cards.name: Exoroid
cards.text: Spawn - Any [[Asteroid Belt]] location. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After you defeat Exoroid: Shuffle it back into the scanning deck.

cards.name: Without a Trace
cards.text:
Your extensive search on board reveals that the crew of the vessel vanished without a trace. There are no signs of forced entry and no corpses to be found. After rebooting the ship's AI, you learn that the starship was named the Cassilda, and served as an experimental spacecraft testing a new generation of anti-matter engines. The final logs before the blackout describe an unidentified bio-signature approaching the Cassilda at an alarming velocity. Despite the mysterious disappearances, the starship itself appears to be in pristine condition. You could try to take advantage of the situation and repurpose the vessel for your own needs.
You may either (choose one): - Assume command of the ship: If there are no clues on Derelict Ship, replace the Derelict Ship with the set aside Cassilda location (keeping all tokens and attachments). Add this card to thevictory display. - Scavenge the ship for parts: Draw 1 card and gain 1 resource. Shuffle this card back into the scanning deck. Victory 1.

cards.name: The Pallid Mask
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play under the control of an investigator at your location. [free] Exhaust The Pallid Mask: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, you may move to any revealed location. If you fail, take 1 direct horror.

cards.name: Martian Crab
cards.text: Spawn - Any [[Mars]] location. Massive. [reaction] After you successfully evade Martian Crab, spend 1 clue: Deal 2 damage to it instead of exhausting it.

cards.name: K-11 Survey Unit
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play under the control of an investigator at your location. [action] Scan. Choose a connecting location and exhaust K-11 Survey Unit: Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with an icon matching the chosen location and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

cards.name: Shielding Device
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play under the control of an investigator at your location. [reaction] When an investigator at your location takes any amount of damage and/or horror, spend 1 resource and exhaust Shielding Device: Cancel that damage and/or horror.

cards.name: Stasis Cube
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play under the control of an investigator at your location. [action] [action] Test [intellect] (3): If you succeed, remove 1 doom from the current agenda and cross out 1 tally mark under Impending Doom in your Campaign Log. (Group limit one success per game.)

cards.name: Universal Archives
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play under the control of an investigator at your location. [action] If the top card of the scanning deck contains an icon matching any revealed location, exhaust Universal Archives: Scan. Scan as if you were at that location. Shuffle the scanning deck.

cards.name: Alienation
cards.text: Revelation - Put this card into play in your threat area. Your maximum hand size is reduced by the shroud value of your location. [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, discard Alienation.

cards.flavor: At first, it was only a small sacrifice.
cards.name: Cyber-Cultist
cards.text: Spawn - Any [[Colony]] location. Forced - After you perform a successful scan: Place 1 doom on Cyber-Cultist.

cards.name: Solar Eclipse
cards.text: Revelation - Put Solar Eclipse into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When you initiate an investigation: You must either take 1 horror, or your location gets +2 shroud for this investigation. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Solar Eclipse.

cards.name: The Dark Forest
cards.text: Revelation - Put The Dark Forest into play in your threat area. As an additional cost to trigger an [action] ability, draw the top two cards of the encounter deck. Then, discard this card. [reaction] At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, discard this card.

cards.flavor:
There are still laws and regulations in space -- but no one 
to govern them.
cards.name: Space Pirates
cards.text: Spawn - Nearest [[Starship]] location. [action] Spend resources equal to Space Pirates' remaining health: Parley. Discard Space Pirates.

cards.name: The Stars Were Right
cards.text: Revelation - Attach this card to the location with the most clues without a copy of The Stars Were Right attached. Forced - After you fail a skill test by 3 or more at the attached location: Place 1 doom on The Stars Were Right. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard this card.

cards.flavor: The strange alien creatures are theorized to be attuned to the galactic magnetic field -- granting them the ability to travel faster than light.
cards.name: Void Byakhee
cards.text: Spawn - Any location without clues on it. Hunter. Void Byakhee moves as if all locations without clues on them are connected to each other.

cards.flavor: An eruption of radiation engulfs you, attempting to suck your life force away.
cards.name: Solar Flare
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). For each point you fail by, you must either choose and discard a card from your hand, or take 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.name: Radiant Crown
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Put Radiant Crown into play next to the agenda deck. Increase the difficulty of all skill tests by 1. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Radiant Crown.
